summary: Good Projects for Learning but Salary is not Good
pros: Tech Mahindra is best for onsite opportunity and client interaction. One can polish his communication skills, for example, you may have direct calls with onsite team frequently with no lead or manager in between. They have good projects in various technologies for different clients. For US client, timing also is good i.e. 2nd shift which you may or may not suits you.
cons: The biggest cons is Salary at offshore which is not per the market standard. You may consider this only if your goal is to be at onsite location otherwise you will feel that you are under paid. They had recently changed some of the policies like, bad appraisals, reduced paid leaves, etc. The environment, transportation, food also not so good and hardware like Monitor also so old sometimes.
adviceToManagement: Please provide good appraisals and CTC for new joiners so that they can continue at offshore.

cons: no good projects and only one major client which is BT.no opportunity to learn and grow , I know people who joined in 2009 and still there package is around 6 , 100 % increase in 7 yearsone guy i know , he joined at 2.9 lpa , in 3 years twice appraisal happened and his package reached 3.1 lpa , few freshers joined after him and there starting package was 3.4. a guy remains at almost same package in 3 years and a fresher gets more than him after 3 years.I changed my IDU in hope of entering some new project and learning something,it was just before the appraisal , my previous IDU gave me lowest rating as i was no longer in there IDU.only way to change this is by leaving the company , but it doesn't have any good projects so u cant learn and move out of it.I did some certifications on my own and then i was able to leave this organization.in 4.5 years in tech mahindra my pkg increased from 3 to 4 lpa . total 3 appraisals in 4.5yearsafter leaving Techm my appraisal is 12 lpa in just 2 years after two switches, which if i have remained in techm would have taken time till my retirement.oily food , only suited for marathi and andhra guys, seating arrangement is cramped , if u just bend u ll see ur neighbors face. then there is no work and then there is recording of your screens , if no work then u cant do browsing too.transport is expensive and uncomfortable.no onsite opportunity , as soon you resign on site opportunities will come up and false promises will be made , do not fall for them and leave it.it is only suitable for marathi guys who are natives from around and keep working in same organization since they passed out of college, also there is state based regionalism.it better to open a provision store near your home than working in techm as a fresher.Now they have started employing B.Sc. Graduates and there pay is same as that of security guard sitting at the gate , maybe he earns more.A very small gym for thousands of employees , there is a queue on every machine.infirmary has 2 beds(double decker) , u ll always find 2 people sleeping on a 3 by 6 bed.they will have awards like star performer this and that award. I know star performers whose package hardly has gone beyond 6 lpa.some guys who dont know any programming language , no technical skills are made designers because they lick bums of IDU heads.then there is a concept of mahindra Rise , like company is rising and there will be mandatory quiz's for it , while only one thing is rising is anger and hopelessness in the employees.once a guy wrote about Rise in a public forum and there was a huge response to him.his article was later removed.In short not a good company , run before your life is ruined herealso I think they are posting fake reviews on glassdoor and other sites to lure more victims

pros: No Pros in this company. People just wants work to be completed no matter what.
cons: Timings: Company policy is to have 9.5 hours at desk. The tool installed captures your activities in the computer. That tool's work hour should be 8.5 hours. That means only 1 hour of break and you end up in the office fore more than 11 hours.Location: The office is present in Hinjewadi Phase 3 which is one of the extreme corners of Pune. From wakad, this is around 15 kms, but due to heavy traffic it always takes around 1.5 hours to commute in single direction. So in total, you spend 14 hours away from home.Leave Policy: Every month only 1.75 leaves are credited. Yes!!! For some godforsaken logic, it's 1.75Weekend workings is very common. Tech mahindra offers Rs 200 for weekend working of minimum 5 hours (seriously!) Which makes so much of difference!!!!
adviceToManagement: Change your leave Policy. Have flexible timing policy. There's no work life balance. Try bringing some policy to address that

pros: Good company for getting access to new technologies

pros: Insurance is available but poor coverage.
cons: Since out LCC many changes have occurred. Not of which are good changes. Because they underbid their projects by so much the field techs are the ones that pay. If there are people in the area that have no experience and will work for less, they will have them work instead of the experience and more senior on the project. The insurance is less expensive out of paycheck but you will pay premium for RX. Management will not pay overtime, instead they will have you put the OT onto other weeks to save them money but employees will lose.
adviceToManagement: Wake up! If you keep putting inexperienced and cheap workers on projects future clients will take other vendors so the jobs can be finished properly.

summary: Wonderful colleagues, flexible work culture but with few chances for development
pros: Got wonderful though rigorous training, fantastic environment and easy going colleagues. We were even given the training to get groomed in neutralizing pronunciation. Though it depends on project work-life balance is better than most of the companies. Peaceful, stabilized atmosphere where you can settle after getting good experience level.
cons: Appraisal process (especially normalization) is not transparent, which impacts the ratings that are given by our managers.The tools are not up to the mark and it takes 24 hours to reflect even a small address change. We are submitting manual forms for many benefits like LTA & others.Managers should understand that associates are also humans and need to enjoy the holidays of India whereas it is not fair to make us work on important Indian holidays too for developing the business.The internal infrastructure is worse so that an associate has to go by himself to the inventory and replace his damaged keyboard.We were not given with any annual compliments though many associates have completed more than 5 years in this company.Only a few number of celebrations and even if you are working in support project the managers are not ready to speak with client/onsite team to support instead of offshore even though onsite team is enjoying as clients.
adviceToManagement: Appraisal process should be transparent i.e. discussion should be there during normalization process.Should initiate more no. of celebrations and functions which will refresh the associates and please don't give payable dinner.Clients should be taken to good fine dining restaurants instead of giving them lunch/parties inside the campus itself.Management should consider about associate welfare too, though we are ready to give value additions it is not fair that by sacrificing Indian holidays we should give support for the operations."Even the designation given by your company is not showing up in any career websites including this Glassdoor"
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: back office support soucks big time..

You end up spending 40% of your time chasing people for getting support for resolving your issues with desktop/laptop/network/procurement/HR/finance/salary etc.. adviceToManagement: grow up and hire a better CEO...

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time

pros: Good leadership development programs like AIMers, GLC program, 1000 leaders program and Young CEO program. These programs offer good opportunity for with initiative and drive. Top management is accessible and open to ideas.
cons: Really poor HR processes. Be it onboarding, updation of employee details, or any interaction with HR, the experience was poor. Company was going through a merger process but still I expected better internal systems. Something as simple as guest access cards for employees who forget their id cards is missing. Too many portals to access information and knowledge sharing portals are not frequently updated. All this reflects a general indifference to employee engagement.
adviceToManagement: Hire good quality talent for HR function. Internal processes and policies must be directed towards simplifying the life of the employee and improving engagement. Also, for a technology consulting company, the use of technology within the company premises is shockingly poor. You can't expect employees to be brand promoters if they face poor experience. Finally, the company culture needs to improve to allow more transparency and collaborative spirit among employees. Right now people tend to guard their turf zealously, hoarding information for no particular reason.

pros: Work roles at small companies are often less specialized than at large firms. That means employees get to wear several hats, interact with staff more often and are afforded a 360-degree view of company-wide operations. Because employees have more visibility, it is often easier to advance in a smaller organization.Another benefit is that employees often gain experience in a variety of areas, giving them multiple skills and areas of expertise to enhance their resume. Small firms may also have more flexibility when it comes to considering alternative work arrangements such as flextime and job sharing. Working for a small company can also be a good stepping-stone to a larger employer in the same field.
cons: On the downside, small firms may have fewer formal training programs and their benefits packages can be more limited. Additionally, opportunities to transfer to other departments may be limited or non-existent. You may also encounter less opportunity for growth and promotion at a small firm.

cons: Ridiculous salary hikes. Huge disconnect of top-management from the requirements of the grass roots. Bias even among managers based on regionalism in some locations. Lack of appreciation for junior level employees, unless you are ready to kiss some butt. No conviction in exit interview from the part of management to retain talents. Instead they foolishly hire new ones at higher cost, with the overhead of sacrificing many days till they become attuned to policies, and standard practices and start to deliver, if at all, in any real sense.
adviceToManagement: Stop being greedy. Share not just pay cuts and pains while there's a downturn, but also the profits and joys when the company is making profit year on year.

summary: Worse Management, Politics, Buttering, Less Salary Hike, Policy in Company Favor
pros: Brand:- A Stable IT company with a Big brand which matters sometimes.Stable:- You have a stable job if your are not ambitious i.e less focused and want to see a long association with out any growth.Opportunity:- Good opportunities for fresher as they have no choice for salary instead want to have experience with a a company with a Big Brand.
cons: Buttering:- You should proficient buttering your supervisor to get good opportunity.Politics:- If you are good at doing politics along with buttering then you are the brand ambassador.Hike:- If you are hard working guy and ambitious but your manager or higher authority is in favor of politics and prefer butter then expect less or no hike. There is strong politics who will get how much package, they will always try to keep you in dark.Worse Management:- A lot unskilled managers with strong political background. They know only bring clients and collect money from them. As per that they employ middle level managers.
adviceToManagement: Keep Vigil eye on Middle level management and their skill set., Have a feedback system to get insight about what is happening behind the hood. Create good environment and facilities for engineers and developers as well because they are real assets of the company. Bringing projects and releasing money from clients is not sufficient. As an integral part, Quality of products matters a lot. If developers are not getting good incentives and are victims of politics made by senior management then company is somewhere compromising with quality.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time

pros: 1. Your reporting manager is your God. This simplifies what you have to do next2. Relaxed Work Environment. Top Management least bordered about innovation or employee grooming (you can sit back)
cons: I am not writing this because I am unhappy but I am shocked to discover "Values" of Tech Mahindra1. Nobody works here - Top management, HR, Admin or other support groups. Only IT employees work2. Worst top management I have ever experienced. They don't care about innovation, project sales or bagging new customers3. Employee gets nothing other than salary. trust me "Nothing"4. Your reporting manager has power like CEO of this company. Infact I or my colleagues have never meet CEO of Tech Mahindra since 5 years!5. Reporting manager can get you promotion, rewards, leaves and everything. He can even get you fired without reason!6. You will only meet HR during your induction. HR people are just overhead to this company. Their work is to find out ways to trouble employees. Employee motivation7. The most un-innovative company I have ever worked. They don't believe in training employees or grooming them. They will keep persuading employees to groom themselves and get company new business (best part is they still wont give increments every year!)8. Increments happen as and when company wants (mostly once in 2 years). Increments of top management happen every year. TechM management is highest paid in IT industry (Not even No. 1 company TCS's management gets paid so much)9. The list is endless but companies like Tech Mahindra simply exploit their employees
adviceToManagement: Please resign if you are human beings. Business is for profit but you are using it as your retirement plans!

pros: I have worked with Tech Mahindra for around 3 years but i could not find any pros of the company
cons: 1. There focus is more on how much time employee gives to the company instead how much work he does. You need to complete 8 hours in company even if you have completed 7 hours 45 mins, it will be a half day. If you have good relations with Manager then fine otherwise you will lose your half day of leave.2. Very bad increments.3. Worst appraisal process i have seen ever. Appraisal letter which is due in April, are given in August or September.4. If you know buttering, you will rock but if you think that just by doing some hard work you will get appreciation and promotion, you are wrong.5. Policies changes very often and all for the benefit of employer6. Release from a project is very hard.
adviceToManagement: Give a flexibility of time to your employee, you should be bothered with amount and quality of work and not with the number of hours of an employee. Make appraisal system quick and honest.

summary: It was a nice company until some Baniya's took over and are snatching away the IT Job feel out of it.Now its Labor Class

summary: A place with full of politics; It's full stop to your career growth
pros: Nice place to sit in cafeteria and spend your timeFlexible in timings of working hoursCultural eventsIf you are a senior manager and above here, then you are settled. No need to work all.All poor people from 3 yrs to 10 yrs experience will fight within themselves and work like hell in order to get a good appraisal. And finally you don't need to give them good appraisal; give some crap and promise that they will be recognized in the next appraisal. Keep doing the same until they leave the company. Continue the same logic for new employees. This is our Mantra!!!
cons: you join as a fresher in this company with 2.6 lakhs per annum.And after 10 years you resign from the company as a senior technical associate with the salary 5.8 lakhs per annum. Considerably good growth. But I don't see this as a negative point because these 10 yrs you simply did some crap work nobody cared. Now, you don't have any technical skills, but you can do some crap work on whatever project you are assigned to. so you cannot move out of the company; also the company do not leave you. it's a sentimental employer-employee association.On the other hand, the important disadvantage or issue here is:Now you are a 10 yrs experienced person with 5.8 lakhs salary and your title is sr.tech associate.But at the same time another guy joins your team with 4 yrs experience with 8.2 lakhs salary and with the title same sr.tech associate. Now the ego starts. you both fight each other. spoil the environment. management also encourages this because only when there is a competition, employees work well. So totally every employee loses peace of mind.
adviceToManagement: completely revise all your crap policies.change the organization hierarchy.tg1, tg2, tg3, etc., it's crap.a person needs to wait nearly 5 yrs for promotion and gets frustated.think something like tg1.5, tg1.8, tg2, tg2.5, tg2.8, tg3.0i'm not literally meaning that. but some gradual growth.make sure your key technical resource and a fresher do not have similar salaries and similar titles.i often saw freshers with title technical associate and very very important key resource with the same title. then how will you satisfy the poor ego of human beings?? obviously there is much politics. Senior management never cared about this. appraisal system is crap. promotion is completely based on your immediate manager. if your immediate manager is a fraud, then your life is ruined out. performance measurement mechanism should be changed. team work should be encouraged instead of individual performance which leads to ego issues and spoils environment.

pros: Good training facility is here but again depends on trainer.Work culture depends on your team. I have seen both political and non-political teams.Some team has really good technical knowledge. But not all the projects are maintaining process properly.
cons: I felt each circle behaves as mini company. So, its difficult to get circle transfer even if your skill matched projects are not there in that circle.Managers have lots of power.Hikes depends on your project ratings and market condition. Merely you shall get 10-12% in average for top rating.Appraisal Normalization is there.
adviceToManagement: Salary should be revised as per market standards. Sometime skilled professional are hold in the circle even though proper projects are not there. Due to less hike good resources are leaving companies.

No policies for work from home. Very less paid time off. Higher management does not care about employees, nor do the support functions. Companies like this give indian IT a bad name.
adviceToManagement: Have a hard look at your support functions, especially HR (compensation), Finance (Claims), RMG (Visa Cell) and the average time to turn around individual request. Instead of giving gyan on advising customer how to run their businesses, get your house in order first

summary: Just another software company (on downfall) of India
pros: I joined the organization when it was Mahindra Satyam (i.e. in transition to become Tech Mahindra). So, it was a decent company to work for during the first half of my tenure there but, as now it has become Tech Mahindra, let me provide the Pros for that only:-> Decent name to get your profile attached to (Mahindra's)-> Most of the projects are support related, so, no deadlines but day to day tensions which depends on project to project.-> Can make a network if you are on bench ( ;) happpens everywhere though).-> If you are good at bargaining, you can get a good package as a lateral hire. Atleast take the offer letter.
cons: Most the people look for this column (human mentality) --> Very less salary hikes-> Not enough good projects left now-> Lot of politics at management level-> Lot of regionalism (way beyond you can expect).
adviceToManagement: The name SATYAM, ruined totally after takeover.Please try to get some good management guys on board who can look beyond regionalism and personal gains.I hope the same enthusiasm will prevail someday.

summary: Good organisation with less job security
pros: Work-Life balance is good. Shall get plenty of time to spend with family but need to spend mandatorily minimum 8.5 hours in the office during weekdays.
cons: The job is insecure. If one is without any project, the company would ask the employee to leave. The bench policy is not employee-centric. If an employee spends more 90 days without the project, then HR would intervene and may ask the employee to put down his/her papers.The salary increment is very less or nil. Growth is stagnant. If no promotion is awarded to an employee for more than 6 years, then HR would intervene and might ask the employee to resign.
adviceToManagement: Please make the organization more employee friendly. Employees are refrained to use lifts in case there are client visits. It is the employee that bring name and fame to the organization.

summary: No work satisfaction, lack of proper management,leadership, lead ask juniors to face the client when escalations done.
pros: Don't join this company at all, forget to work here. This is for freshers and experienced. If freshers join, then don't work more than 2 years in this company.
cons: No work satisfaction, lack of proper management,leadership, lead ask juniors to face the client when escalations done. leader ship is only interested to take the credits when proper execution of projects take place but runs from responsibility in case of trouble and expose juniors in front of client and run away. TechM management never protect their employee. also no job security is here in this company. employee value zero (rather negative), they have zero bench policy period for which is just 4 weeks. that means if u sit on bench for 4 weeks, direct termination after that, Also many ladies were terminated immediately or were not taken back to work after returning from maternity leaves.
adviceToManagement: higher management and HR people are bastards in this company. worst level of politics is played and appraisal ratings are changed in round table discussion of higher management. I observed rating given by manager was different and in actual after final result it was different and answer of manager or IDU head is that it has come from HR, I gave different rating. IDU head also have no value in the company. Its one man show company run by HR and corporate head and his team.. No advice to be given to the management of this company as its a gone case management. I worked in thsi company for 6 years, I got client appreciation and rating given was C, my manager said that he gave me B. It was converted to C at HR level and immediate termination after working for 6 years and even after getting client appreciation in the last appraisal. When a project is changed in the middle of the company, you feed backs from previous IDU is not counted and as appraisal is done purely at IDU level, so no value to the good work done at previous IDU or project. pros: Take home is good. Internal movement is there but in most cases manager screws up. They teach you to be shrewd, frugal and mean and it somehow reflects on your attitude. To summarize: You will be passed out as a demeanor if you graduated just 2 years in this appraisal scamming blackhole.Guess it's good for fresher just to start a career and better leave off later. The management has admitted this in the press release that they will fire mid-senior candidates...(sigh)
cons: Trust me but Its a downward spiral from the day you get here:1. Frugality at its best. You have to simply beg to people just to get a laptop (for project assigned people only). It was a laugh riot to see one laptop being shared by 4 senior resources. Felt like cyber-apocalyptic world when I just entered.2. Analyse this: Management gulped all appraisals for hard working people and they dont even care to send a mail to employees any reason for doing so. There is a leakout in press, just to manipulate share prices but not even a single mail to their employees.3. Take less salary or leave : Yes, this is what has happened. Guys who were top performers had no salary impact(forget the appraisal) but ppl with lower ratings got less than actual salary. People grow everywhere but here, there is a downward spiral. Funny part is the company's motto which is.....wait for it....drumroll: "RISE"4. Amenities such as AC/water coolers have been cut down.Rest are just pity and below the belt to state here.
adviceToManagement: LOW PERFORMER CEO: Very simple question. Just to save your behind you are firing guys who have 10-15 yrs of experience. You did know about Tech M businesses and offshoring for US projects and the TRUMP's policies for more than a year. Why didn't you create a strategy to safeguard the most important resource of an organisation(people). You severed off people just like that to show cost cutting and satisfy investors. . Mr CEO, guys did their contribution to the projects and gave such precious time of their life to TechM while you were just twittering around. I believe you are the least performer here.

summary: Looks good but not good.. Its like all that shines is not gold..
pros: Good in telecom industry and services.Lot of training.. sadly not good trainers and any positive effect by thoe training.Fair Onsite opportunities.. mostly (say 80%) to UK.. Thats too for a single client which is BT..
cons: 1. There is always a realisation that we are POOOR people.. financially, strategically, techncally, proffessionally2. Always feel - this is the dead end of the career. No growth technically, proffessionally in organisation.. Nor they pay you well to hve some external pleasures. Only pays for Roti, kapda and makaan. Hand to mouth salary3. Lots and lots of politics around.. Purpose - Do something and stop something to happen bad.. This causes lot of dissatisfaction ad frustration among employees..4. Discovers news ways and policies to cut down people salaries.. Financially gives a damn to employees..4. Same with deliveries. Not concerned about the quality. More concerned about quantity .. just to show off the management.. we did so and so5. A manager does not care about employees. Senior manager does care what manager says. Group head does not care what Senior manager says.. and IDU head does not care whats going on in the IDU (until something is escalated). No values to juniors, their needs, capabilities, feelings. etc etc..6. Junior employee does only what the manager says.. A manager does only what Sr manager says. Sr does only what GH says.. etc.. Blindly do what your boss says, w/o caring about ur juniors..7. Very bad management. One who works, keeps workinng.. one who does not enjoys hinmself thriughout and sees ways to satisfy his boss (unproffessionally) just because he can survive more time in the company..8. Favortism at its best height..
adviceToManagement: 1. Care about your employees. They will think about you. Employees work harder for money and growth. IF they do not get it, they will never work whole-heartedly throughout.. Self-motivation does not work for long.. They will stop one-day..2. Create some policies that are employee friendly..3. Create a good atmosphere by giving equal opportunities and growth..

position: Null

summary: Very bad Pay package - Unprofessional variable pay disbursal - Average quality of work
pros: 1. Onsite opportunities - I was lucky to get some really good onsite opportunities during my career with TechM. And during this tenure, i got some really good exposure facing a very big client - AT&T, and also i got decent vertical growth(though i had to really fight for it).2. Onsite rotation policy is being implemented very strictly, this will definitely give opportunities to fresh people.But, still i feel there's a lot of favouritism in favour of Pune location.There are so many people from Pune, that seem to have settled here in US. Why are they not ever rotated?3. There is a really good amount of flexibility. I feel this depends largely on your immediate supervisor. And i was lucky to have very understanding managers mostly.I'm still on good terms with all of them.
cons: 1. I think its good for initial few years of your carrier. Good compensation for less experienced people. Very bad for experienced ones, salaries don't increase much, not anywhere close to the industry standards. Most of my batchmates' offshore salaries are almost 3 lacs/annum more than me.Over the past two years TechM has been getting rid of various benefits they used to provide to employees. Starting 2008, they drastically decreased the US salaries also(even though the dollar rate has been significantly high).2. They behave like slaves of their clients. Top management doesn't think much about negotiating with the client about changing the timings of offshore teams. Continous night shifts. It frustrates people.3. Very poor compensation for night shift and weekend support.4. Variable pay is never given on time. It's July right now, and 25% amount is still pending from Q4 2009-10.5. Very poor cab facility, even though they charge for it.6. Very bad infrastructure at new locations. People don't get the phones with mute buttons. Leaves bad impression on clients.7. Bad quality of people being hired recently. Not many people have good communication skills.8. Company doesn't know how to retain its best employees. Very callous and unprofessional attitude of the top management. Many important and critical people are also leaving the organisation now, which is sad.
adviceToManagement: 1. You guys need to start thinking about your people more in terms of their pay structure, may be you need to revise the salaries of good performers.2. Emphasis needs to be given on grooming your people technically.3. Curb this politics in favour of Pune. You are a global company, try to start thinking about the welfare of other locations as well, they're also your employees.4. Increase the transparency about what initiatives the company is taking for getting new projects from sales and marketing perspective.

cons: Office timings are bad...the transport, atleast in mumbai is bad...just one fixed time for the bus...if you ever get late you will have to come to office yourself...and if you have to come to office on weekends the compensation is much less than the amount you spend on travel and to top it all there is nothing other than biscuits in the canteen. and the locality is not that great to have some decent restaurants.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

pros: Good for freshers.Gives them a scope and a feel of working in big MNC.
cons: Compensation- Varying cycle. When i joined the organization the Increments were in effect from July. Although you would usually get letters in September or October and you would paid the difference later. In 2013, it was informed in August that through Media Houses that the increment would be in effect from January, eating up increments of 6 months more. One would expect that this would lead management to give better hike but that is simply what 1 would expect. This is all while Tech Mahindra is daily surpassing new highs both in terms of business and share market and as many of my fellow Ex-TechMighty know that this isn't a win for employee. Promotions are questionable and reward policies seems to be a rotational policy most of the time. This year company has changed their Apprisal Cycle from October -September and increments in effect from January every year onward. Management policies keep on changing. On one side they sing song of alternate thinking n ideas n RISE Culture but when it comes to implementation they have to simply follow the same industry standard where-in industry standard means any means wherein earning of Company increases and in most cases at cost of Employees. Very Employee unfriendly company. I had waited huge amount of time to get out of the company and when the day arrived i didn't feel any regrets.
adviceToManagement: Management should be more Employee Friendly and not just reiterate those words. They should worry about their high Attrition Ration which I clearly remember CEO CP Gurnani mentioning as not of much concern (Attrition Rate at that time: 19% Approx). You guys didn't even feel to inform your employees first before informing such things to market. Open up, empower your employees and believe in them.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

pros: Absolutely no pros. If you are working in this company , you are obviously not good at what you do . This company is more like a stop gap for people who come from small startup like companies . Companies like CTS , TCS ,Infosys are far better in every single imaginable way.
cons: Worst company to work for. Company has generated huge profits every quarter over the past several year but the upper management doesn't even have the decency to share it with its employees (who in fact are the actual reasons why such profits were generated in the first place) .Appraisal for a full whole year was not provided. Instead of sharing the profits , more cutbacks were done . Right now, there are almost zero allowances.
adviceToManagement: CP Gurnani should stop begging the employees to follow him on twitter and read his pathetic blog . He should in fact focus on the welfare of his employees instead. He is definitely not role model material . No employee of tech mahindra is interested in his motivational/philosophical non-sense . He is definitely not a LEADER!

pros: Tech Mahindra is my First Company..TechM gives you all possible access to transform you from being a student to an employee. Training period in TechM will be at its best.Atmosphere: Its almost 3 years of journey in TechM and I have always enjoyed the atmosphere in TechM. Most of the TechM campus are amidst green environment and you will always have place to sit and chat. The same goes with various clubs.Job Guarantee: Be noted that you are working in one of India's leading MNC. Hence your job is guaranteed at least for first 3 years after successful completion of Training.Onsite opportunities: I got an Onsite opportunity exactly in 1 year post joining TechM. TechM has clients in as many as 50 countries. 2 in 100 are assured with Onsite opportunity in TechM depending on the project requirement.Opportunities to improve your skills: TechM always conducts session on various tools, domains and technologies to keep the employees stay updated with technologies that are required to sustain in market.
cons: I mentioned that Training period is at its best, However, the ways of training is not the best in the market. Still, bookish kind of training is provided in TechM.You will have reasons to wine at the salary, because it will not please you the most.Exit during training based on OLA marks (Multiple Choice Questions). MCQ's can't determine one's ability from my perspective.Just like any other MNC's even TechM is least bothered about your career ahead. They may ask you to work on a tool, domain where you never wanted to work.
adviceToManagement: Am not that experienced to advice my management. However, I had been in the management's place. I would tie a strong bond between the associate and management. Because many a time, management forgets that a company may loose a good employee because of a bad manager.Apart from this, I respect my management for their efforts in making TechM the best in this globe.

pros: * monthly commission is good, depending on your campaign (campaign is depended on your ability to sell)*Three / O2 run incentives (phone / vouchers / etc.)* Free food here and there, occasionally order dominos for the floor.* 20 days paid holidays, 1 day added for every year worked* 1 absence only counts for the time your out (i.e.. 1 day = 1 absence or 1 month = 1 absence all depends on how long you are out for)* place is generally laid back
cons: * management is a bit hit and miss but not the worst I've seen* TL's commission is based on what the team gets, which causes them to push for the wrong reasons* The place is shrouded in secrecy, information is kept very close to TL's and management, associates are only told on a need to know basis.* A lot of change takes place, I.E seat change and campaign swaps, hard to settle in. your commission can fluctuate because of this.
adviceToManagement: generally this is a good place to work, very laid back with an equal balance of work and banter. if you were to compare Tech M to Eishtec you would find yourself in heaven

pros: Typical day work is reading and responding to emails from managers, clients. I have learned to handle a group of people with different personalities. Managers were like life supporters. Excellent teamwork is always present. Patience are like roots of a tree, very deep and in need to survive.Our big bosses are very approachable and very professional. cons: Salary structure, Facilities need to improve(pantry), same as Computers

adviceToManagement: Increase pay scale to internal associates who are talented, skilled, loyal and due for one, instead of outside hiring. summary: Working as a Software Engineer in Tech Mahindra
pros: I am working in the Hinjewadi campus for the last 4 years. It is a beautiful campus with loads of activities going on around the year to make the associates work life better. The training system if you join as fresher is very good, where they prepare you on the technologies like Java, J2EE, Advanced JAVA, UNIX,SQL, PL/SQL to name a few. Not being a profile based training you are free to move to technology of your choice and choose projects accordingly. (though theres a limit to how many projects you reject and that is understandable.). They have Some very good projects, some not so great but the hierarchical management system is good. In short a good place to work in.
cons: Don't expect huge raise, it will be always in the mid range, and the story seems to be same for all top MNCs. But the job security kind of trumps it if you want a settled career.
adviceToManagement: Please don't change the otherwise good policies of tech Mahindra just for the sake of being competitive in the market.
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: Worst Company! They don't care about employees
pros: Good Work Profiles (depends on project)Fun and cultural activitiesBrand Name on your ResumeLearning opportunities
cons: Worst Salaries:Salaries are not as per experience and talents of professionals.Worst Appraisals:Managers will push you for hard work and long hours work all the year but at the time of appraisals , you will get nothing after all good and hard work.Not a Employee friendly company:Company don't care about Employees , their needs, their work-life balance.Poor HR Management:HR is just puppet here. They never care about Employees and their issues.Cheap politics by Managers:Managers will screw you up by all means. No salary increments, Rude behaviors, No leaves are common here.Extra hours working is encouraged by managers. Managers are happy only if you will work till midnight 12-13 hours a day.Racism by South Indians towards North Indians.No work life BalanceManagers makes fun of your personal problems.Getting "leaves" is like getting "God" here.No matter how good is your presentation, it will be bad till last moment and Managers will expect you to work 24x7 to correct it. They don't care that you have family and personal life too.Managers are involved in spreading rumors and fake stories about employees.
adviceToManagement: Give good Salaries to Employees, Provide good salary increments. Don't encourage Racism and provide leaves to employees. They are your employees, not animals. Provide Healthy work environment to them.Last but not least: Don't feel bad if they leave your organization after all dissatisfaction. They work for money and work satisfaction. They are not slaves of you.

summary: One of the most competitive and dynamic environments to work.
pros: Some of the best minds in the industry work here.In some projects, serious cutting edge work happens - high end consulting and implementation.There are great salary perks and growth is very quick for those who can shine well.
cons: The appraisal processes are quite random and your growth is highly correlated to what impression your managers and peers carry about you.The facilities offered in the offices are bare minimal.The leave policies and transport policies and extra-hour compensations are very restrictive and not great.
adviceToManagement: Rework on policies that can be more employee friendly.
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

summary: Your growth depends on what your manager wants
pros: Continuous Learning, Behavioral and Technical TrainingsChat sessions with different senior people time to time however it is not completely transparent.Cultural activities, TechM has its own band.
cons: Management Policies : they can change any time and most of the times in favor of company onlyCareer Opportunities are good but to take an opportunity you might need to fight with your manager. Sometimes to take another opportunity in company itself one might need to submit resignation. Your growth totally depends on your manager.
adviceToManagement: Some people wants to stay in the company and want to give their all for the growth of company but for the company they might be a burden, we get internal job openings but the process to apply for them is not in favor of employees. Also despite of having good revenue this year appraisals were not good. Company asked for employee feedback but feedback results are never disclosed to employees. I advice you to be more transparent in your policies, TechM changes its policies whenever it feel and mostly in favor of company only, please consider your employees as well. You have vision 2015 but if employees are not happy would you be able to achieve it. I would say that RISE is not being followed by company management. Please take care of your employees (resources for company).
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

pros: A-Z of Telecom solutions.Too many trainings, events or CSR activities to get involved when you are having lot of spare time.Brand value, atleast trying to 'Rise'.
cons: Regional politics. Favouring decisions/appraisals to the beloved ones.Innovation, without soul.Survival of the neediest.
adviceToManagement: Please ensure to bring back the dignity of the company and earn employee/client respect, by not falling into the errant of the customer, and do whatever they want to do.When we talk about innovation, there should be room for everyone/project to do it. Projects survival should not be based on 100% billing. Also constant mentoring/handholding of the employee should be in culture, rather than isolating him/her. Otherwise innovations won't be innovations, just another keyword and only few who are nothing to do else will be in limelight.Also please stop the shopping spree (inorganic growth to become biggest in India) and wasting money on too many events. Then as usual employee benefits are deprived one by one after claiming that we are in debt.

summary: Fast growing company with poor people practices
pros: I have been working with TechM since October 2014 as Technical Architect. Found the campus is very beautifully laid out in Hinjewadi Pune with large food court, gym, basketball court and library. Company spends a lot of effort and money in promoting fun activities/ extra curricular activities. Very good place to start as fresher as they provide required Industry and technical trainings required to start their IT career. Majority of the clients are big telecom companies hence good exposure for people in the telecom domain.
cons: Company policies and objective and your Project policies might differ. The TechM designation and your project role can vary and differ. There is no distinct roles and responsibility defined for each employee management believes everybody can do everything. Also career growth inside TechM is confined to your project hence internal opening are limited and not transparent. Also after working with top MNCs for last 11 years I found TechM does not have career developement plan for its employees. Work life balance is not good as you have 9 hrs work time, limited holidays , work from home facility.
adviceToManagement: Be employee friendly rather than being client friendly. Happy employees make happy customers. Promote employee engagement and career growth across TechM Projects.

summary: Good at everything except where it counts
pros: Good work life balance, good management, easy access to managers. Variety of projects across domains and technologies. Lots of onsite opportunities as majority of projects are in US/UK. Good cafeteria, facilities like gyms, swimming pool, sports like badminton, TT, basketball, tennis, etc. Decent cab services, has lots of private bus services as well.
cons: Like I said in the title, TechM is good at everything else except where it counts. The salary structure is dismal at best, and appraisals are worse. There is no industry standardization. The only way to have a good salary hike here is to put down your papers and then negotiate with management - because you can withdraw your resignation even on last day of notice period.
adviceToManagement: Give better appraisals. Don't be arm-twisted into giving good hikes only if a person resigns. You should reward loyalty over arm-twisting.
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: How good is Tech M to work for

cons: The very lack of processes makes it difficult to even get basic issues sorted out, like those related to on-boarding. Then off-course the issues with not paying well enough and off-course bias in the recruitment process. Its not a very open process. Hence may leave you in a sour taste.
adviceToManagement: Saying that you are entrepreneurial is good. But using that as excuse for not fixing even your basic processes like HR will not do you good.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 8 years)

summary: Good for Beginners, but not for any growth
pros: Good exposure for a fresher to emerging technologies thanks to Tech Mahindra's wide range of customers which is now seriously waning. A free hand to work on any environment as long as you deliver. Somewhat flexible timings.
cons: Being a fresher I saw a lot of regional bias and favoritism as soon as I joined. It’s been three years now on four different projects and something that has stayed common is that the management has little to no technical knowhow. The work load is not evenly distributed among the team, majority of the people get away doing nothing while the other members have to slog trying to meet the days deadlines. These few to my surprise have the full support of their seniors. Tech Mahindra is not very hesitant giving one certificates of recognition for the exemplary efforts one may put in. Unfortunately, this at the end of the day is nothing but a color printout with your name on it in big letters on an expensive glossy sheet of paper. This recognition although does not translate into promotions or appraisals. Furthermore, long work hours sometimes even on the weekends when you are not on call ruins your work-life balance...Looking back now I have no semblance of a life anymore.
adviceToManagement: Clean you act up and treat your employees with a little more respect and consideration, and learn to differentiate between workers and shirkers.

summary: Higher level management is not good, HR management is also not good
pros: One thing I liked about working in the company was working with such talented colleagues and learning on the job from the most experienced people. The company has a good online training website which gives you opportunities to learn that is only when you have that extra free time.
cons: The company doesn't give too much importance on their employees. Pay is not as per market level. PDP is not consistent and the process is questionable. In some projects, employees are forced to work on weekends or extend long hours without pay and would actually scare you with a termination letter. The company or some bosses also promise salary increase but remains unprocessed for a year. Higher management are not willing to listen to its employees.
adviceToManagement: The company should treasure their employees. Be more sensitive on their needs and do not do forced labor.

pros: The trainers were good and selection procedure is also quite good.
cons: They will never pay you full salary HR will always have some kind of excuse to explain that.They will delay your salary that you're expecting on last working day to 15th of that month because you did not update PAN details that you already did but their system couldn't read it. After contacting concerned HR he tells you that you can borrow money from friends or family. Even if it is their system's fault the company will not pay any penalty for delayed salary.same goes for attendance system as well even if you have not taken any leave in the end of the month they will show 5 unpaid leaves and they know that it is their fault but now the money deducted can only be remunerated in next month's salary.Nobody knows you exist other than your training team.
adviceToManagement: Please look into the way how things take place on the floor.

summary: TechM- Good place for freshers, but not for experienced professionals
pros: Good work life balanceGreat place for Fresh Engineering passouts, who want to prepare for MBA, MTech or Civil Services, as work load is very less, and people get time to prepare for entrance exams even when they are in office.
cons: Less salaryLimited growth potential if one is looking for progressing career in the IT fieldSaturation in quality of roles after some yearsNo choice of location or projects. Your interests won't matter, they will allot any role or project, like Testing, Support etc, even if you are interested in Development roles.No choice of location. I requested the HR management many times for a transfer from Mumbai to Pune,due to some personal reasons,but no, if you are a fresher, you won't have any choice of location.
adviceToManagement: Learn to take care of employees. Employees won't ask for Crores of salary or a transfer to LA. All they want is good working condition and decent salary. Hire some educated HR managers, who can understand all these things. Start caring a bit for employees, and see the productivity of the company grow exponentially.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

summary: great place to learn if you are not after money or position. But have to forget future too
pros: Tech Mahindra is my first employer and it's been a journey of more than 2 years. It is a great place to work. Good exposure to various technologies and we can explore all most all kind of training open to all employees.
cons: It's better to describe it as a business place rather than calling it an IT industry. Employees are treated like laptops. Once your warranty is exceeded you are thrown out with out any notice. No respect towards the employees. Filed with politics in almost all projects.
adviceToManagement: Kindly DO NOT follow USE AND THROW mechanism on employees. Show some respect. we are humans just like you are. Glad that I realized our position and started looking for other opportunities.

summary: Tech Mahindra is just like any other Organization
pros: 1) Work Life balance2) You can do well if you are technicaly competent.This holds true for every comany.3) You can atleast give feedback on articles writen by CIO and raise your voice in forums like Freevoice.4) Training of entry level joines is good.
cons: 1) What matters is billability, your technology set doesn't matter.2) Need to improve the process in non BT and ATNT IDU's.3) You have to run after IDU's heads to take appovals on RAM upgrade, travel. For project work we need to upgrade to 2 GB RAM, and it took 4 months for IDU to approve it.4) Your personals belongings/mobiles are not secure in office. It will be stolen if you leave them on your desk.And company is not responsible of this.
adviceToManagement: 1)Gone are the days when managers can survive in IT industry by just filling up excel sheets. More then people managers, we need Technical managers.2) Improve the processes in non BT/ATNT IDU's like BSS.3) Improve your payment(salary) process. Please invest in a good ERP for internal operations.4) Ask IDU heads and middle level managers to intract more with there IDU members.
position: Null

position: Null

summary: Not a company I would recommend
pros: Work location is convenient. I was at Sharda Center office which is located within the city limits so commuting to work is not a hassle. My manager was understanding - gave me time off whenever I requested.
cons: Tech Mahindra has this stupid policy of logging your time in office (at least 8 hrs) and they deduct your salary if you are in office for less time than specified. Needless to say you do not get overtime if you work more. Their policy for promotion and performance reviews are adhoc and depend on your relations with your manager.
adviceToManagement: Look for ways to improve employee retention. Try and change the organization work culture which suits a brick and mortar establishments, not a knowledge based organization.
position: Null

pros: No need to work.Just timepass and be good to your manager.Learn Office PoliticsLearn any technology without actually working.Get some Certification ,serve your Bond Period and then resign.There is no realization of your training & Certification from the company.Threaten resignation to get On site and go there to get pennies.
cons: PoliticsLack of Professional Managers.Lack of processes to check the work delivered by Senior ManagementNo Transportation.Top Management is too busy writing blogs without caring about improving the business and profits.They instead blame employees for the rising costs.Not an employee friendly company .It is neither Business minded.
adviceToManagement: Guys focus on Business.As you are busy writing blogs in the intranet site and twitter other companies are posting 24% to 50 % increase in quarter to quarter revenues.Do justice to the salaries you guys get.Behave yourselves.Learn corporate. Governance from other IT Majors.Practice before you preach.Do not mince the Salaries (Variable Pay).We know you guys walk away with preferential Share allotment.You may let us down but you are accountable to the Share Holders,Promoters,market regulators and most importantly to the customers.Do a 360 degree review of all folks above the level of manager and implement the results.

pros: -> Good tier2 IT service provider.-> Has projects and clients across globe.-> Good Job security-> Work life balance depends on project / client / management-> Ample travel opportunities-> flexible work environment-> Friendly colleagues who support each ot
cons: Cons list can get longer than pros :)-> has all typical problems with Indian IT Service provider organizations.-> middle level management is like sitting ducks without any power. middle managers are mere messengers who run between their team members and management-> Offshore work culture is pathetic with strict average working hours-> lack pathetically on Process and innovation-> Clients use Techmahindra as cheap option to dump support and operational work-> Wonder how they been operating for such a long time with such a pathetic Human resource team and system.->HR team and process is just another department who work as clerks for management.-> compensation and benefits are at rock bottom and they are no close to Tier1 Service providers-> Compensation depends on your level of negotiation after resignation. No salary hike happens irrespective of performance.-> Learning curve will be flat. Their training is as good w3schools.com. No external training / certifications offered.-> lacks transparency.-> management is run by old retired 'C' class executives who think they own the company and employees.-> Bloated work force.
adviceToManagement: Employees are the engine and fuel of Techmahindra. All business and revenue are through billing of individual employees. Lose employees -> Lose business.Bright talents don't prefer TECHMAHINDRA for a reason.Can't pay penny and expect bright minds to join TECHM.Immediate Action : Treat your employees well. Old school management must be changed. Needs serious shakeup at the higher management to retain business and people.management lack transparency. Communicate sensitive news to employee through direct channel rather than employees learn them through media :)
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 5 years)

summary: Need to change the direction to grow

cons: Incapable middle level management such as Project, Delivery, BU managers
adviceToManagement: Get more business from existing client and new business from new client by retaining technical resources instead of retaining and paying more salary to managers, invest the money on technical resource instead of buying small companies and showing resource head count.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

pros: The organization supports growth opportunities, and is supportive of work-life balance. The culture and values do not encourage the typical hierarchical manager - reportee structure, and encourages transparency within the team.
cons: The overall culture depends on who is the head of the delivery unit. Some delivery units encourage very protocol oriented culture - follow the escalation matrix strictly. There is absolutely no 'open door' with such management.
adviceToManagement: Maintain direct contact with the junior most associates. 'All hands meet' is not such forum. Have frequent skip level meetings.

pros: 1. Great company for freshers. The ITP training is one of the most demanding in the industry. You will get trained across various technologies in the most gruesome way.2. Onsites, Its comparably easy for a fresher to get an onsite,however given if you land in a good business unit. Also most of the business is UK/Europe centric where Work Permit norms are not as stringent as H1B in US.3. Work Culture is good,lots of freshers. Hinjewadi campus is absolutely beautiful,set amidst mountains.4.Lots of fun activities and also its encouraged by management.
cons: 1.Being a telecom centric company and also telecom companies are facing the heat, your job is not secure when compared to TCS,Infy, Wipro etc.2.Lots of Marathi politics.3.Quality of mid management is awfully bad.4.HR,RMG needs to be improved big time.
adviceToManagement: Make policies more transparent. Especially if a associate completed 18 months in a project, he should be allowed to move into another project. Rotation in onsite also should be taken care of.

cons: Managers very autocratic.Culture is very restrictive. Especially about timings. People like to come in late and stay lat even if there is nothing to do.If you disagree with management or even seek clarifications on policy you are certain to have a very tough time. Transparency is non-existent. Huge politics especially favoring members of a certain community.Promises of new projects and onsite opportunities do not always materialize even if an employee withdraws his resignation.HR is very unhelpful. Before travelling on-site on asking about a written copy of the policies and benefits I was told - "frankly nobody has the time to give you the policies in writing." Also if you disagree with management, HR is the last place you can expect to receive any solace.On my last working day, HR wasn't available for exit formalities and no exit interview was conducted.If you are an Oracle Retail resource, my advice would be not to join this company.
adviceToManagement: Be more transparent and stop the politics. HR is meant to be a support function and the least they can do is to do their jobs.

summary: Career depends on the projects that we get.
pros: Good start for freshers.It all depends on the project that we get to work on. If you get into a good project then career growth will be considerably good, luck may favor for short\long term on-site opportunities . Campus and environment will be great.
cons: If you don't get a project and bench days has increased then you may have to re-skill(applies to experienced associate too).At the worst scenario like recession you will be forced to exit the organisation.HR can work effectively to get employees into projects.Freshers or sometimes even less experienced associated have to sign bond.
adviceToManagement: Appreciation and recognition should be done by project managers. Only few managers do this. Recognition need not be a reward it can be Word of appreciation which will encourage the employee and motivate them.There are many awards in Tech mahindra but the Higher management should take some steps to track these and make sure that hard working people are being motivated.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

pros: 1) Green Campus:- Fully green campus with solar power supply2) Good Package at the time of joining.
cons: 1) No Shared Resource Policy - Resource is released from project once the work for SOW is over.2) None Competent RMG - Once we are on bench we have to search our project and after 60 days we are shown the doors to walk out of the company3) Puppet for Peers:- Inspite of being project manager, entire decision making such as Selecting resource or reusing existing sources or billing the resources or interacting with client is all at the desecration of Competency head. Project Manager is never allowed to intract with client and task will to deligated to on-site client representatives with no power to manager. NO PROCESS IN SHORT.4) Only Excel:- None of the projects use project management tool and every thing is done using excel.5) No Business Team:- Every resources is expected to bring ideas and business. There is no seperate business or process team who would analyse existing business and propose new functionalities.6) Nine Hour in campus Policy:- Regardless of you having to attend evening calls it is mandatory to stay inside the campus for 9 hours. You will have Factory like feeling.7) Cafetaria:- No good food in cafeteria.8) Work from Home:- Only 3 days allowed but at the descreation of Manager. Only for P1 band and above for male employee
adviceToManagement: Please act on above cons before it is too late.

pros: None to think off.My advise is to avoid at all cost, if you don't want to ruin your career and attitude.
cons: Management only knows how to deal with H1 visa holders from India because, they are slaves and at Tech Mahindra's mercy.Don't have a clue about dealing with experienced professionals. I am an Indian, who came to the US to study in the 70's and I could not tolerate them. I guess, one must have worked in India to understand the colonial mentality. World changed after second world and the collapse of the British empire. Britain changed, but Indian managers have not. Lowest price is not a long term winning strategy. My MBA, professor used to say being the low cost provider and cutting cost (the denominator), is a sure route bankruptcy.
adviceToManagement: Emabrace American management in the US, embrace country specific management style or pack it up and go home.Hire US professional managers on high positions and listen to them. Staff US HR with US personnel and listen and learn.One thing Tech Mahindra taught me was to, never work for an Indian company. Duly noted.

position: Null

summary: Overall, dissatisfied and of course lack of opportunity to excel.
pros: There are opportunities at TechM. If you have a good influence at the top management this is the place to work and you will get an onsite opportunity even if you are a fresher. It is more Pune centric and all the good projects go to Pune. Other locations will get the leftovers.
cons: There is no proper skilling. Ego problem with the Senior to Top management. Too much of politics and favoritism. Promotions lack proper performance review of the employees and just buttering our boss will automatically enable us to promotions. When there is a new opportunity available there is no proper planning or analysis or strategy to build the account and enhance. No proper recruitment of the resources from within or lateral. The people who cozy with the senior management will get onsite opportunities and need not be properly skilled even for that.
adviceToManagement: There is no management strategy or vision. Whenever you get a new account or project please look at all the locations and not just Pune. Please while recruiting people for the newly acquired accounts look at the expertise of the people to avail KT's and ask their commitment. Last advice please allocate the right people for the right job and there is severe lack of coordination within the recruiting teams.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 5 years)

summary: Very less Job Security as compared to other big companies(beware of other false reviews with 5 stars)
pros: 8 hours of working. Somewhat flexible timings.Person will get to learn a lot of things technically, as well as process wise.Good canteen at pune hinjewadi campus.
cons: In current scenario of slowdown, I would NOT suggest anyone to join this company unless one is in desperate need of job.Job Insecurity: TechM is mostly dependent on BT, ATT projects. This projects are generally of very short duration (around 1.5 yrs-2yrs). Once project is completed, employee is released and put on bench. Now real problem arise here. The RMG(Resource Management Group) people do not help employee in allocation of another project. Employee have to search project on his own(if he has contacts), other wise after 1-2 months also he is project-less. Now another horrifying policy of company comes into picture. Employees are randomly called by HR on any fine day and are asked to resign (else he will be terminated). Overall job security is one biggest factor which is NOT in TechM's dictionary. Even if the person is billable, he is working under fear of getting released/terminated.Appraisals: If person (generally with work experience of more than 4 yrs) is getting C rating, he is asked to resign by HR.Monitoring the employee: In BT projects (which forms major part of TechM projects), they have installed a software called 'Sapience'. This ridiculous s/w is used for policing/monitoring the employee. It tracks how much time employee is spending on project and non-project activities, and also how much time person was at his machine.No new projects: Techm is hugely dependent on BT, which in turn has grown smart and asking TechM to work at very low costs. This in turn is affecting work culture. Comp. is unable to identify newer projects/business since 2-3 years.Other Policies: Support team/HR team is not employee friendly. Sometimes even they do not reply to your mails.Summary: If one want to learn things and move to next company in 1.5-2 yrs, then it is okay to join. Else do NOT join this company if you have long term plans. You will feel job-insecurity each day you come to office.
adviceToManagement: Please have some fair policy when dealing with on-bench employee

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (Less than a year)

pros: Freshers are given lot of work which in turn results into huge learning on the job experience.
cons: No HikeNo promotionNo trainings/certificationsvery less and biased onsite oppurtunityBad management and biased work culture.They have softwares installed on emplyees' computers to check their activity on the computer. Not only online but offline, which means a report is generated on how much time you are spending on which document or outlook or communicator.They also have softwares to calculate how much time you were sitting/not sitting on your system.if you swipe out 10 seconds before 9 hours is completed, it goes to your line manager for approval. if he does not approve half day salary is cut.
adviceToManagement: Try to trust your employees and do not install these meaningless softwares in their systems. This de-motivates the employees and also reduces productivity instead of increasing it. Try to be a little employee centric. I remember in one quaterly meetings our manager showed us the ESAT score in our vertical ws only 2.8/5 whereas they were targetting 4.8/5 CSAT score and 3 as the ESAT target. This gave us a clear message on how important our aspirations are to the organization.

position: Null

summary: Learnt a lot but still there was no growth in terms of designation and salary.
pros: Senior leadership is good but middle management is not capable of implementing the decisions taken by seniors. With Satyam's acquisition there are new areas they can focus on which would reduce their dependency on British Telecom and telecom sector as a whole.
cons: work life balance is really bad. Also, the compensation compared with other companies is very less. Middle management is self centered and does not care much about the growth of junior members in the organization. This is evident by the fact that Techmahindra has among the highest attrition rate in the IT sector.
adviceToManagement: First of all Techmahindra has a bad reputation regarding job security. I personally know a few campus graduates who were selected by Techmahindra but for not given joining dates until around 18 months after they graduated. Moreover, almost every year a lot of contract employees are laid off. The strategy to hire employees from smaller companies on contract basis is not working and reflects badly on the quality of work delivered by Techmahindra. There is an immediate need to work on employee satisfaction.

pros: Good salaries to employees in Canada.
cons: Complete lack of management. I only spoke with my manager when there was issues with the “client” but there was no guidance what so ever.I was working an average of 16 hours a day even most of the weekends and my bosses did even know that.10 day vacations a year but never was able to take more than 3 consecutive days and always even in vacation I must answer the phone and log in the computer to fix problems. (Calls are day and night as India schedule is the opposite of Canada)With the amount of hours I was working at Tech M easily I could have two jobs and be less stressed.
adviceToManagement: When you come to countries like Canada or USA the employees expect to be treated by the laws of our country, we do not want to be treat like the people of India (no disrespect intended) Here we have rules that must be follow (like the maximum number of hours a employee should work a day/week)I saw many people coming from India to work here threatened if they didn’t work 16 hours a day they will be send back to India.

summary: One looking for money should nt join
pros: 1. Bright candidates are given good job-roles irrespective of designation.2. Organization offers anything but money part is saddistic

My take home reduced after being promoted as the variable component % increased to 20% but overall salary increased by 2 % only. Was quite shocked on this4. Employees are treated like guinea-pigs. Appraisal cycle is always delayed by 6 months or so. Hence you loose out on arrears anyway & get meagre 1-2%hike in the end.
adviceToManagement: Freshers cannot do justice to every job-role with1 month of training. Be competitive in terms of salary standards as well

summary: A very well structured company to start your career with.
pros: 1) Well structured ITP training for freshers making all the newbie to come at similar platform.2) Good HR policies in terms of leaves and timing. ( much relaxed compare to industry standard)3) Excellent work space to work.4) Good entertainment activities keep going on through out the year by JOSH team.5) Training on different technical skill sets are available to attend by Learning and development team.
cons: 1) No structured to process to allocate freshers to the project. Most of time its a random allocation.2) Lack of good projects from other domain. (After MSAT merger it may not be a flaw.)3) Growth in term of salary and domain knowledge is very slow. You are bound to work on a particular project most of the time. ( Not a personal opinion ).4) Hike is not up to industry standards and mostly determined by a flawed process that has nothing to do with the real efforts put by a associate.
adviceToManagement: Please do not put distant goals for associates. Before putting up the goals make sure you know how to achieve those goals.

pros: It is pretty good company overall. The management is very friendly and I loved the atmosphere and it takes time to adjust with the other employees.
cons: Converts to small shops wax enthusiastic about the room to gain experience in new practice areas. They are able to return to the nuts and bolts of operating a business, to its heart. At a large corporation you get divorced from what the business is all about, according to Mike Barnes, a newly hired logistics executive at Halton Company in Portland, OR. He added, in “The Advantages of Working for a Smaller Company”, that the depth of involvement he has at his new firm has another upside: A level of job satisfaction he says he hasn’t felt in a long time.
adviceToManagement: The downside is that you might risk getting yourself pegged as a generalist or a Jack-of-all-trades. If the company does well, this may not matter. However, should the company falter after a few years, you'll be on the market again and you may have lost your edge, if you have a technical specialty area.

pros: Onsite opportunity and long term projects.
cons: Everything else. Management is very poor. Compensation is minimum. They will make you work 12-14 hours a day and on weekends and on holidays without paying any overtime. They are just exploiting their employees. They don't care about their employees. A person doing good work gets less salary than a person doing no work. No appraisals at all. They have more non-technical middle managers than the resources who do actual work. If, say, they have 2 resources on the ground doing work then they have atleast 3-4 middle managers who try to supervise those 2 resources. It is a good company for managers, who don't want to do any work. This company is very cheap and miser.
adviceToManagement: Treat your employees in a better way. Remove extra middle managers. Try to keep good resources happy. Most of your good resources have either left or trying to leave the company.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra (More than 3 years)

summary: Good entry point for technology strategy
pros: Chance to work with a small and talented team on high visibility technology consulting engagements. Good portfolio of offerings and opportunity to be part of the complete lifecycle (sales to delivery) of engagements. Chance to travel extensively to multiple geographies, interact with senior management of clients and work on short term consulting work (typically 2-3 months).
cons: Extremely poor HR policies - completely hands off attitude and no support for employees onsite on assignments. Poor living conditions - cheapest accommodation (e.g. B&B) provided irrespective of location safety and logistical ease to the client. Lack of management focus to mature consulting practice. Good place for young single people looking for a stepping stone to technology consulting and willing to rough it out on travel and gain hands-on experience.
adviceToManagement: Invest more in people (improve quality of life) and consulting practice.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

pros: Flexibility in moving across domains/projects, Some of the colleagues are highly talented and experienced
cons: Tech Mahindra - Mahindra Satyam is a company without direction.Although top management tries to implement innovative ideas, the layer from Senior Managers to VPs are resistant to change and nullifies any improvement. TechM recruits from institutes like IIMs and give them substandard work. One of the last IT companies where you are expected to address managers as Sir/Madam! "Boss is always right" mentality is widely prevalent, and that is the only way to succeed in this organization. Hyderabad DC is especially notorious for this, with strong parochialism and language dictatorship. Merger of Tech Mahindra with Mahindra Satyam has started a cold war between senior managers of erstwhile entities - to the point where some of the teams refuse to work with each other. In short, this company is a classic example why Tractor makers shouldn't do IT,unless they understand the difference in culture of the respective industries.
adviceToManagement: Enforce quantitative KRAs and promotions based on themTake measures to end the cold war between erstwhile Tech M - M Sat managersTech Mahindra is hiring some great talent and giving them sub standard work - give them avenues to perform and grow.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

summary: A Place where You Kill your Career.
pros: None for the people who really want to work.Flexible timings is the best thing which the company offers.Best Company for the people who have a whole lot of luck.If you dont want to work, then you can gossip with your managers and there is always someone else (some of your team mate) who will complete your work.......and in the end you may get the benefit...because till then you are the favourite of your Manger.They show FIFA world cup, each and every match LIVE(maybe because MSAT was one of the official partners).
cons: Opportunities are never given on the capability or rotation basis, its given on Favouritism.Your Immediate manager is your whole and sole Boss.You work for maybe 100 yrs in this company...and yet you wont come to know about the HR policies.Beware!!! any day on the last week of the Quarter, you may get a letter saying "Inconvinience is Highly Regretted", and then you come to know that you wont get your Arrear/ Bonus/ Variable pay etc. this month (and even not sure about next month).Nothing is well planned, They Hire Thousands of freshers from College. But God knows when will there joining come. If you are lucky, then within a month else maybe in 1.5 yrs. If they call you then also its quite likely that you maybe sent back home...the reason being "Company doesnt have enough Projects"Appraisal is a mere Joke. There is no transparency.
adviceToManagement: Want some transparency in Appraisal.ITP training is a curse to many, moreover when you never use those technologies....because maximum people here never do any development.
