position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra (More than 8 years)

pros: Fast moving - quick decision making when the right people are involved.Willing to invest in acquisition.
cons: An INDIAN company. Although it has significant global presence, it is run by Indians for Indians. You need to break in to the 'inner circle' to make progress.Unstructured. The leadership promotes the company as 'Entrepreneurial' which, in my experience, meant that everything was made from scratch with very little standardization. Approvals were based on who you know; processes are designed to be 'bent' when the right support is in place.No clear responsibilities. Everyone is responsible for everything - which in practice means nobody is responsible. Job descriptions and organization charts are very hard to find.Employee engagement. Employees are valued if the leadership perceives that they have done something significant for the business (mostly sales influenced). If you do not fit in this box then you should expect to be treated as a worker bee.
adviceToManagement: TechM's success today is based on the performance of individual leaders in the company, not on the organization. To achieve the growth that TechM has as a goal, there needs to a change in mindset to productize and standardize the way they operate. There needs to be a cross-pollination of capabilities between internal silos, and the values that the executives preach need to be realized at the lower levels in the company (onshore and offshore.)

summary: Don't work here if you are not from India
pros: I have been working in IT for over 17 years. I moved to Fargo to accept a Technical position working for Tech Mahindra on contract with AT&T three years ago. It was ideal position and I was recognized from the both the Tech Mahindra and AT&T client for my technical expertise and customer service. Tech Mahindra is big company that have IT positions all over the U.S.
cons: If you get in the company don't expect to be promoted or get a increase in salary. They are extremely bias and discriminate against employees that are not from India. All Management is from hired and placed with blatant favoritism towards employees from India. My qualifications, technical skills, dedication and outstanding customer service made me ideal candidate for a Management position. Despite my hard work, exceptional performance, I was let go because I inquired about Lead and Management positions when they became available. They have available Management positions but they hire there own nationality. This was supposed to be over 5 year assignment and they will let you in favor or less qualified. Tech Mahindra Management can be unprofessional and disrespectful to its employees. They pretend to be courteous but they speak in there native language in the office about you. I filed a complaint with EEOC and ND Human Rights. I currently have law suit filed against them for discrimination.
adviceToManagement: You are working in the US and we have laws against treating people unfairly..
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: So absurd it was almost comical
pros: good benefits and good PTO.
cons: country club-like environment with loose atmosphere. A lot people you deal with here are lazy and get combative when you call them out on something which effects your ability to be successful in your job. It seems like they will never let go of anyone here at this office even though there are signs they are only just mediocre at their jobs. They don't give you the tools or teamwork to get it done. Instead they place unrealistic pressure and expectations while others on the team can't handle their own work loads so they won't take responsibility for their mistakes and blame others for their incompetence.
adviceToManagement: learn to improve your people skills and communicate better to employees instead of just delivering things how ever you like, you're dealing with people. Realize the team dynamics to identify the difference between those that have pride, work hard and care about doing a good job, and those co-workers who aren't passionate in the slightest.

pros: I like the people I work with (my peers).
cons: The Tech Mahindra onboarding process is one of the most disorganized, confusing processes I've ever gone through. Rather than having a single sequential checklist (even better with an HR person to walk you through it), it's a confusing blast of emails from different people.
adviceToManagement: Make your onboarding process a sequential process, step-by-step. Rather than having your New Hire onboarding be just an information broadcast, integrate the onboarding steps into the New Hire training so that by the time you're done with the training, you're done with the Onboarding.

pros: The in-depth technical knowledge of the organization as a whole in the telecommunications domain is excellent. One of my previous roles involved a lofty title and no real ground breaking work done on a day to day basis - but with Tech Mahindra, you are in the trenches and you are resolving significant issues.
cons: There tends to be a silo mentality with certain teams in the organization, and they harbor an us vs them attitude. Further, there tends to be a certain element of persecution complex with the overworked teams.I did not and still do not like the signing in and out of work to ensure exactly 8 (or now 9 hours) are spent in office - it encourages gaming of the system.
adviceToManagement: Management needs to recognize and grow people - so that they are not stuck doing the same or similar jobs for ever.There needs to be greater training opportunities - in technical and soft skills.

pros: I don't see any reason to appreciate this company
cons: I was hired in A7 Location of Noida and joined this company in expectations of good career growth, however, this is the worst company I have ever worked with in my whole career.The management led by GS and DJ in recruitment is worst. There is highly politicized environment. They first lure the candidates from market in the name of brand value. Once candidate is placed successfully then they start torture, harassment and will make your personal life hell. Further, you will never know what is your actual salary as your monthly salary keeps decreasing every month. I had to fight with management to get my Full and Final Settlement that too when i threatened them with legal actions.Once they hire you, they will start making your life hell, they will ask you to come on Weekend to work irrespective of the fact that you are working in night shift, then they start finding lot of faults in you in case you are not expert in buttering. Further, if you don't toe their line. If anyone planning to join their Noida US Recruitment team led by Gurusharan, beware that this may be start of your bad days and you will regret your decision.
adviceToManagement: I would suggest that Higher management should initiate strong action against these managers who are highly politicized and not genuine. They first lure candidates and then start firing them one by one that is the reason attrition in US Recruitment team is all time high and 80% employees are planning to leave as they do not see any future there. Neither do they see any growth.

pros: Open environment for all, since the merger is coming about, its an exciting place to work at. Good infrastructure. Processes in place for everything. Fantastic Learning and development team and infrastructure. High visibility.
cons: Most of the processes are fractured. The necessary functions are sub standard and while there are processes, noone seems to follow them. adviceToManagement: bring more transparency into the appraisal systems. give more power to the HR department.

summary: Experience at Tech Mahindra was dissatisfying, with salary that was below Par and meager hikes leave one disappointed.
pros: U do a lot of work and ultimately learn.
cons: 1. RMG works in a irregular manner rather than hiring people from a place to work there they hire people from some city train them at someother and allocate project at some third place. Cherry on the top they move you from one city to another as many times as they nedd but pay you reimbursement just once. Pathetic policies and exploiting the freshers is one of the things one will find prevalent at TechMahindra.2. Salary is low as per the Market standard but the hikes are even less and demotivating at the end after spending two years at TechMahindra one would be earning less that what infosys is paying to a freshers at that point of time as they(companies like infosys) revise the salary package accordingly.
adviceToManagement: Be a bit more responsive towards the Freshers. Change the Compensation Structure and last but not the Least the support function people(RMG) really need some trainingso that they can work in the right manner.

summary: Very less salary hike, no promotions
pros: Only if you are lucky you will get onsite thats it. It might happen you may have visa but no onsite. It happened with me for 2 times. If you have buttered your manager he might create onsite opportunities.Talking about salary hike - once you join stop expecting salary hike and promotions.Salary hike would be 500-2000 Rs per month maximum. If you are joining the company your band will be decided based upon your experience but once inside very thin chances of promotion. Buttering role is important.Now a days i have seen so many h1b holders, my friend, are lined up for onsite opportunities. As off now no onsite for US. Trump effect may be.So if you spend 4 yrs of your life here and you dont get onsite. Your salary will be lowest in market.After 4 yrs my package is frm 7-7.4 , pending this years hike.So guys make wise decisions about your future
cons: Very less salary hikes though company is doing goodLess chance of promotionRare to find good manager, as all are elevated by buttering processPolicies are different for managers differ much in work from home, tax benefits, onsite positions etc
adviceToManagement: Share the fair share of earnings with employees dont be surrounded by lame managers sit with u1-u4 band people who are real earners.

summary: Cannot find a worse company in UK to work for

cons: Very bad senior management, no vision, no processes or defined way of working, pathetic salaries at onsite (one needs to actually think if one can afford rent or not), very irritating and impolite HR, extremely parasitic culture on BT, experience can be gained only in number of years - not in actual growth like client interaction, management, etcTech Mahindra is one of the worst places to work in the UK. The few neutral comments it gets from customers are published as 'praises' and the hundreds of emails from clients being concerned about substandard quality of work are supressed and never shared with anyone.This company can only be praised by someone who has started their career here, since they do not know any better companies. adviceToManagement: Revamp the culture else you will regret horribly when BT or other companies you are parasitic to close down

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time

pros: Main campus at Pune Hinjewadi is good to work at. Also the training opportunities are good. And that's the only possible positives I can think about.
cons: Higher management's average functioning style can be best described as autocratic, though there are some exceptions. There is lot of hidden regional favoritism at play and if you are not from the regional community, then all the best for your stint here! HR is just a dummy and a stooge of the higher management and will not do anything even if you complain to them. Also performance management is a big farce here.
adviceToManagement: Please be aware of employee sentiments better. When a large number of people complain about their management layer, you ought to seriously investigate those management people and independently review the major decisions taken by them. Alas this is not happening as of now. Also empower HR so that they have the guts to investigate higher management based on employees complaints.

pros: The brand is quite strong as a IT Service company.They claim being the largest startup and therefore agile and flexible.There is an interesting family and industrial story to tell customers, however this is not the reality (outside of India).
cons: The internal processes are made for India and not fully applicable in the RoW.TechM does not pay well the commissions.Acting as a startup results in disorganization when there are over 100 000 employees.Because of this lack of structure, people tend to reinvent the wheel every single day which results in waste of time and frustration.A high turnover results in having mostly junior people.Difficult to trust people in the organisation when you are not from India.
adviceToManagement: Be less India centric. Be open to other cultures. TechM cannot win in trying to act Indian everywhere around the World.

summary: The whole organizational system needs a
pros: 1. Focussed in telecom domain.2. Strong in OSS/BSS domain.3. Good to start career as a fresher.4. Onsite opportunities available for juniors

Policies are not transparent specially those related to compensation & salary5. No career growth path unless you get favor from higher level.6. Poor salary; bad hikes; variable percentage too high as compared to similar profiles in the industry7. Lack of "engineering" culture8. No system to nurture and groom talent internally.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (Less than a year)

pros: 1. Pay structure is good2. If you are billable to any client, the whole CTC you'll get in your hand after deducting Tax and Provident Fund. This includes your variable pay in your monthly salary and you don't have to wait for 6 months/12 months. If you are not billable, then also you're eligible to get at least 60% of your variable in your monthly salary.3. If you have a good relation with your manager, no need to complete stringent 9 Hrs in office.4. You may get onsite opportunities if you are lucky..
cons: 1. 21 earned leaves per year; no sick leave and no casual leave. Only one optional leave per year.. :(2. Became out-sourcing company. They'll hire you on their pay-roll and will depute you in some client place. They'll not even consider for TA(Travel Allowance) for you. Asking them, you'll get answer that it is in same city. So, why you need TA?3. Stupid Appraisal policy. If you are on high package, you'll get hardly any hike.4. Not for Experts.. You'll only get old and junk work for a client. If you expert, better choose a product based company.5. No room for new ideas and innovation (Though so many emails you'll receive every another day)
adviceToManagement: 1. Satyam policy was good earlier. After TechM acquiring them attrition has been increased and this has been an out-sourcing company. Try to change that. Also, try to retain talents in your company rather than hiring another person with higher package. This will increase motivation and faith in employees.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time

summary: Worse experience in my entire career...
pros: Directs were a team worth holding on to. They cared about the client and performance.
cons: Underpaid employees - Far below comparative jobs. Absolutely NO career growth. No merit increases even when informed via company communication. Would allow the client to completely micromanage the managed services.
adviceToManagement: Upper management needs to understand the cultural difference when services are rendered in the states vs overseas. If you fully support a US based client, then you need to ensure the policies adhere to the local rather then trying to supplement it via oversea cultural values. I feel sorry for the women workers as they seem to take the most verbal tongue lashings I've ever seen.Pay your team what they are worth. Attrition rate extremely high and upper management has been informed time and time again. Overuse and under pay... guess the outcome.Stop being YES men. The SOW is there for a reason and if you go above and beyond without recouping anything, you're only hurting the company and the teams.LISTEN to your management team on the front lines. They see what goes on day to day... you hear what we say, but you don't LISTEN.STOP undercutting your offers when you hire people. We lost many experienced personnel when the offer letters were sent out and it's different from what was verbally discussed. Extremely bad practice.I can go on and on.. but no sense, the management cares for one thing and one thing only, themselves.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (Less than a year)

pros: If you are Indian and on a work permit with short term left this company will still recruit you.If you have never worked as a QA before in your life but your spouse is working for them, they will still pose you as QA and recruit you
cons: No work life balance at all.Onsite-offshore model wherein you have a offshore team which caters to what the offshore manager asks them to do. So you are working to make up for 4 resources.No growth plan.Manager and seniors won't respond to your complaints. Always busy in their own politics. You would be all alone to deliver your deliverables.
adviceToManagement: Stop the politics please.Care for your employees. Not after they leave you but before when they work for you.

summary: Worst HR Guys I have ever seen
pros: During the day of your interview they will treat you with respect and promise you everything
cons: They will tell you after 2 days, you will get a call from HR and also give you an email id for you to send some documents. My worst experience is recently myself and my friend attended an experienced interview for java. The interview was scheduled between 10am to 1pm. But it got actually started at 3pm, until then nothing happened there. And it started after eating all our energies :( By 6pm the interview got over and am happy that we too cleared HR round ( the HR person told us).After 2 days we got a call from a HR (Name: Lingam). This guy actually started speaking like a Vegetable selling man for providing the salary we demanded. It's nothing but 30% increase from what we are getting in our current company. That guy fought with us very bad , he also said he can give only 20k more in the annual salary higher than our MNC company and then we lost the interest in the job. So friends please search in all other firms and finally go to this cmpny.Even my another friend working in this company now also fooled by these HRs.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

pros: Nice people to work for but they don't place you properly.
cons: Poor pay and business choices. Basically, the Tech Mahindra office I worked for set up several calling centers for ATT and Fingerhut. I work for the Fingerhut one. As a customer service representative, you are expected to answer numerous customer complaint/question calls throughout the day. It can be very demanding and hard to do this. I found that I was sitting for so much, so long, that my lower back was hurting me. The breaks you get (two 15 minutes ones and only a 1/2 hour lunch) barely help much with this grueling work. Your brain just gets tired from spending so much time on the phone with customers. It's just too tedious.
adviceToManagement: If you hire someone with a tech education, don't place them in customer service doing phone calls.

summary: PLEASE READ THE FULL REVEIW - Manager centric, mediocre centric, depends fully on your luck that how your manager is
pros: 1. Infrastructure and finance team are very helpful, team worked very nicely, at least in Bangalore2. Good exposure to telecom domain, most important domain in business3. Work life balance ..mmm.. ok, lets take that better comparing to worst companies4. They give good package to experienced professionals, because the people who are staying in Tech Mahindra from starting and sticking to the mud, are actually worthless, either completely dumb, or ignorant, or highly egoistic
cons: Now, let me try to put down all the things, so many of them, that I am unable to organize1. NO VISION AT ALL - They don't know what they are looking for, they dont know what they need to do for knowing that, and overall, they don't know what the customer is interested in. They are still in the utopia of 2000 odd time, that customer will eat anything that they serve! Not at all having any vision towards the new trends of business2. COMPLETELY MANAGER CENTRIC - Suppose you have a good manager (which is very rare because the "Old TechM fools" are not good at all, and the fresh bloods are very less in numbers in managerial role), then you will sustain.Otherwise,, suppose, your manager does not like you because you like football and he likes cricket ( or any great reason you can think of), the manager will do anything with you, screw your career, dump you, kick you, whatever he likes.3. This adds up to the earlier points, I have thought in this issue for many days, tried to find the reason why this is so? What I found was, the HR and other processes are NULL. No one can do anything if your manager throws you out, there is no process set. Managers are taken as "revenue generators" and they are free to do anything they wish with the subordinates, just like a construction "pimp" does with the workers. This is complete "Baniya" company who counts money before going to sleep, everything else can go to hell!4. Want some more?..ok...lets see if I can be a little polite...please do not show your capabilities in work, only be mediocre and talk big things, dont ever do anything. Because whenever you are doing anything better than the others, the "Aam Admi" will pull you down and ruin your career. And the most hilarious point is - your manager will do the same, because he is in constant threat that anyone slightly smart enough can take his position! Wondering how it is possible? Yes it is, because client also does not expect TechM employee to do anything smart, because they have hired cheap labors, so even if your team does not give any super solutions for years, project will sustain. Managers will think - who wants to give unexpected outcomes taking their own career at stake?? So, as you understand, things are like this.5. Wait, please, you have kept your patience till here, so allow me to take 2 minutes more to wrap the things up.Low performers are nowhere wanted in the industry. This is absolutely true, And company should think that how to reduce the cost by removing these low/very low performers, absolutely true. Mind the gap..I am not going to argue about whether or not the employee was actually a low performer, or he has got the rating only due to personal grievance what the manager had on him...both the reasons are valid, and there is no process to verify that, believe me!! I will, for the sake of brevity, assume that the employee was a real "baaaad" performer. Now, I have seen what other companies do, they call the employee, give him one month of notice, and tell him to search for job. But, here comes the sweet part - techm HR will call you up, and ask you to resign, and that they will tell you do do in one day!! I have seen people were forced to resign within one hour after HR called him, and...guess what....no notice period...tomorrow is your last day! Funny.. isnt it?
adviceToManagement: Nothing to tell at all...I dont know why you hire experienced people and ruin their careers when you are actually very well equipped with mediocre, blunt headed, "YES SIR" employees, enough in number, to run your day to day business. Please use them, both you and them would be happily living together forever..and let the fairy tale end that way...

summary: Poor organization, poor HR, poor career prospects and poor understanding
pros: Employess within my department (software engineering) were very friendly. They all however had my shared opinion
cons: Being Tupe'd over to Tech Mahindra was a destressing experience. They did not make us feel welcome nor did they make attempts to improve the situation. Their HR is truely aweful, trying to get special circumstances towards expenses is a real effort. They would repeatedly threaten us if we wouldn't sign their altered contract, which we are optionally allowed to do as it is a TUPE move. They would also not agree to maintain certain parts of our original contract despite being mandatory by law.They also stated they would not give us pay reviews for 23 months. They also added me to a role that I am not paid to do.
adviceToManagement: Overhall of HR systems, overhall of HR personell. Research new employees thouroughly (especially those on TUPE).

summary: Not suitable for long term stay - Senior software engineer
pros: Small projects, easy recognition, scope to work in different projects as most of the projects in MES at least are short term.
cons: Appraisal cycle is unpredictable, can be cancelled at any time or on any grounds. Not a trait of an MNC. What you get at the time of switch is your package for coming 4 years or until you switch again. Zero hikes. I have seen ppl with huge experience but salary that of a fresher. It's a black hole. They usually try to lure you in with high switching hike like 45-50% and that's it. Forget the hike after that.
adviceToManagement: Walk the talk. At the end of the day ppl work for two things money and job satisfaction. Neither is guaranteed here, and you wonder why ppl don't prefer to work here.
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

pros: Relaxed work environment. Tech M generally places candidates in offices of big corporations. The atmosphere is nice and the hours are flexible generally. It is an India originated company that has really taken over the IT and other industries. There is plenty of time to learn on your own and the company give many test and self paces courses online.
cons: Most of the live course are on Indian time so the US based staff can't really take them. The pay does not progress with you skillset. The annual review is based on what you can translate into dollars, quantify, instead of the work you actually did. There is a very short learning period. They train you on what they want you to do but you may be trained 5 weeks for a senior developer job. You will struggle the first 6 months.
adviceToManagement: My only advice, the pay scale needs to be revised to compensate the staff that have excelled after 1, 2, 3 years their pay should reflect their progress not a standard percentage.

summary: Strange company that seems to be overreaching
pros: Gets you introduced to large clients in the tech industry in the Redmond area.Work-from-home is expected, in limited frequency.
cons: Bare-bones staffing: will go to great lengths to hire 1 employee to do the work of 3-5 employees, which risks quality. Does not vet for foreign language skills in the interview process, because no management at TechM is actually fluent enough to test language skills. Is supposed to be a global company but has only one person in HR for the Americas branch, which does not bode well in terms of financial stability as a company.
adviceToManagement: Make an actual HR department to oversee paperwork and employee records, don't just pile the duties onto one staff-person based in another state. Whenever someone new is hired, there seems to be a 50% chance that their paperwork is lost or entered incorrectly for insurance. A supposedly large company having so few HR personnel, is likely the writing on the wall that the company is in dire financial straits.

summary: Great people, not such great worl
pros: I had a very collaborative team and good work environment. My manager was very supportive and sometimes would go out of his way to help the team. I learned a lot about managing expectations and negotiating tactics from him and will forever be thankful to him and my team for their support and encouragement during my time.
cons: I felt the work was not challenging enough. Working in an ASG team felt like working in a glorified call center. Also salary increments are not great, sometimes it feels like they do not appreciate what you bring to them team. Also being on-call is highly stressful, especially if your system is an identified high-priority and high-risk asset.
adviceToManagement: Reward employees proportional to their contribution. We feel let down when we give our 100% and all we get is a few thousand as the reward. Also there has to be a way to ensure high-performing employees are identified and encouraged to take leadership roles within the project.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

pros: You wont be able to find even if you try searching one good thing in the company for your entire life.
cons: Starts from the CEO, and other Sr.Management folks here, they are still working on age old failed methods be it there process, tools, office infrastructure and the list goes on. The Sr.Mgmt doesn't just lack vision but also the ability to understand whats good for their company. In world when most of the companies realize the importance of Human Capital Management, management at TechM is still fooling around and cold towards its employees, they have been firing people or provoking them to resign from their jobs, they started that first by axing the Quality head and the trail followed, all this started this year when the Sr.Management could not handle the drop in their stock values and they also stated that all this has happened bcoz of the hikes they gave to their employees this year, I really dont understand the strength of the company which has a head count of 100000 and who has given a petty hike of 0% to 5% to only very few employees cant bear such a drop. The Bottom line is, the management of the company is becoming stupid day by day with its policies and their future is definitely turning into ashes, so you should decide before joining TechM if you would like to touch the sky or turn your life dust here.
adviceToManagement: Old folks in the higher management should be either removed or they should volunteer to step down and hire people with long term vision and importantly bring a change in their human capital management policies.

pros: Pro were....the free time and higher studies partnership...I was a part of TechM from MBT era and have seen the company change,including satyam take over.
cons: Lot of challenges...first being the utter disrespect of employees welfare. If you really have a choice...dont join ...but if you must then keep in mind that this is one ship where the captain is in coma...
adviceToManagement: Wake up...love thy employees...nurture talent to take up bigger responsibilities...stop being insecure...ur jobs are your's BUT work for it...and focus on employee welfare and not just your take home

summary: Good work environment with great learning opportunities but compromise on pay
pros: Recognition for talent, good growth opportunities within teams, Challenging projects, Skill enhancement opportunity, Great work life balance in selected projects. On-site opportunities in some projects.
cons: Poor compensation at off-shore and at on-site at higher experience levels, bad appraisal model. Not so pro-active in bagging new projects, also not many POC's which can be showcased with the client are created/developed.
adviceToManagement: Consider increasing revenue through bagging bigger and profitable projects rather than keeping the perks low to compensate lower billing rates. Invest in breakthrough solutions to showcase to clients so as to brag innovative projects which would in turn increase customer confidence.

pros: Good place to learn functional as well as technical stuffs. Company provides endless opportunities to learn and grow in desired vertical.
cons: Lot of internal politics and remain at top for existing leaders without changing/upgrading themselves and ridiculous salary package creating high attrition rate for skilled employees and company is loosing image in terms of technical expertise. No professionalism followed and similar to factory culture. Due to higher cost cutting, approx no appraisal and low salary package, this place is more suitable for fresher (1-5 years) who will be supposed to handle multiple roles. In singe line, employees have lost their faith in organization.
adviceToManagement: Bring better organization structure which should minimize internal politics, flattering etc and promote to sheer hard & smart work. Bring motivation to employees with valid appreciation and providing atleast industry standard package similar to Infy, Wipro, TCS etc so that employee should not feel embarrass.

pros: Hmm let me think.......When I got offer From this Company I was soo Happy that I am going to join a CMML - 5 MNC But after my Joining It came into my worst nightmare of Life.Well One Good thing in this company is Onsite Opportunity.
cons: 1. No work culture. Managers are like Hitler they will constantly look onto your system whenever they roam to your work desk. If any employee will would take tea brake with another team mates at pentry then If manager watched that he will surly ask "Bhaiya Kaam Nahi Hai Kya" or If after long working hours if some one doing some gossping with another team mates again manager will ask "Bhaiya Kaam Nahi Kya" which is the worst thing I faced in this company.2. One more bad policy is you have to complete 9:30 Hrs in the campus including 9 hrs on System for this tracking there is Software in every System which will calculate each day of your timing on system. If you spend less than a min from 9 hrs they will surly deduct your salary of half day.3. If you took lunch for 1 hr again manager will ask you complete your lunch in 20 Mins only , Hah I can't Imagine manager will go this level of cheapness.4. No Outing for Team.5. No self morale & motivation6. Appraisal are the worst they will give you only 1 to 3% only.7. Salary is also very much less as compared to market standard.8. Timing is not flexible If you reach 1/2 hr late then again manager will warn you in arrogant way "This is my last warning to you".9. Onsite Opportunity, Only If you know how to butter your manager then this place is heaven for you. So for butternuts, this is the best place.10. My suggestion to all new joiners is "Think again. Its better to remain at home and search for another company then joining this one.
adviceToManagement: Try to Replace Managers because manager who are long enough with your company they assumed company is now our private property so they do whatever their wishes with their subordinates.

summary: Why not to work at Tech Mahindra
pros: Not much that I can come up with at the moment.
cons: Negligible to zero pay rise mostly, stupid policies, the senior management take most of the cream for themselves and do not let the juniors working under them enjoy any benefit, illogical policies and management decisions and an extremely overpaid CEO.
adviceToManagement: If you’re not going to look after the employees working for you, you cannot expect them to ‘Rise’ and ‘Innovate’ under you. Eventually, monetary benefit drives all other ambitions and you cannot expect people to innovate, grow and ‘FUTURise’ unless you’re paying what is deserved.

adviceToManagement: Although Tech Mahindra is doing pretty well in terms of it's HR policies (Golden peacock award, GPTW, HR-Excellence award etc.), to grow further I think the management should look at the talent pyramid since population is more in the mid level management.
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: Not so bad Not so good
pros: Onsite Opportunities - Good number of onsite opportunities but depends on the nature of the project as well. Out of my 7 years in TechM, I was onsite for 3 and half years.Flexible timings- Most of the project do provide flexible timings. But again company do have standard working timings. So all depends on your project again.Good work and learnings - a lot of opportunities to work and learn, very less bench/buffer.
cons: Pune location - most of the employees are from Maharashtra, so they most of the times talk in Marathi. need some manners training. even management supports this while you raise your voice.Dominating management - most of the times you will be forced to do what is required to do or join some project which doesn't even fall into your specialization.Very bad appraisal cycles, they keep on changing the appraisal cycle and you may loose 1 cycle in 3-4 years because of this.Very low salary/hike. In hand salary is also very poor if you compare with overall CTC.In many projects no weekend allowances. only comp off provided. That too depends.
adviceToManagement: Please treat bottom level with some respect, at least listen to them every quarter. Please stop discrimination based on language or region.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra (More than a year)

pros: Good campus, spacious working cubicles, cleanliness, Extra co-curricular activities
cons: Very slow management processes, Managers at Noida campus are mostly non-technical and mostly busy in poilitics, lot of favoritism. Most of the Business in Noida and Chandigarh branch is dependent on AT&T. Since AT&T itself is sinking and cutting cash flow so everything is tensed. Mostly support/testing projects remaining. Good projects have been snatched away by other companies like HCL, Amdocs, infosys etc. CEO doesn't care about internal functioning and does nothing to eliminate internal politics of management (apart from empty words). On top of that in every meeting he acts/speaks in a very sarcastic way thinking himself to be very funny.
adviceToManagement: Give good appraisal to the one who deserves and not your favorites. Speak up and maintain your dignity of a manager. Don't behave like slaves to the onsite people. Managers are mainly Yes-man to people working at client site even if they are at lower level in hierarchy.

summary: Good Company Once, Now a Liability for Employees as well as for the IT Industry Overall
pros: 1. Infrastructure and Cafeteria2. Co-Curricular Activities and CSR3. Great Colleagues in Some teams/projects.
cons: 1. No Onsite2. Poor Employee Retain Policies3. Handful of great projects only4. Majorly into Telecom Domain5. High in Politics and the Upper Management is totally worthless6. The Company is filled with people who are there from the past 20 years or so and hence the company is not able to truly grow as these people either play dirty politics or they just do NOTHING for themselves as well as the company.
adviceToManagement: Fire those people up in the hierarchy because they are literally useless and sometimes make low level people's life miserable. Try to retain good resources because now you have got a few only more than ever. Try doing something good to motivate employees every now and then, co-curricular are useless and boring - a utter waste of money. Please do have a look into every project and check what the employees under managers have a say about their hierarchy which I am pretty sure are literally Very BAD !

summary: Was very good when it was Satyam
pros: Good Working Culture, thanks to satyam.Facilities are better than other organisations like TCS because it was all established when it was Satyam and not much done after acquisition.Onsite opportunities are descent.Associates are very friendly and helpful.
cons: Employees are underpaid.Once you are on Bench then your life is like hell. You need to beg for the projects and RMG (talent pool) people are the worst and they never learn from the other organisations.Lot of scrap associates are highly paid because of their influence from the time of satyam.Managers are pathetic and only helpful to their favourites.Lot of Politics.Shifting to other technology is almost impossible.Most importantly the Bench is always risk and it is threat of losing your job at any time.
adviceToManagement: Show confidence on the associates and help them to work in other technologies and dont underestimate them.Please do not target bench people for lay offs, they don't have to do anything with the slow down or anything. Its up to you how you use them efficiently.Identify the scrap and remove them.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra (More than 8 years)

pros: None this is a pure baniya company
cons: No Appraisals 3% to 5% maximum. Some employees who were promoted were not given a single penny appraisal because the company is struggling to meet numbersNo respect constantly your manager will tell you that people have to be pushed and fired as most projects are in negative EBITDAIf you are given a low EBITDA project to do you will be pushed by your manager to make people travel by trains/ buses instead of flying. In such situations the Project Manager will focus on small costs to save like Hotels, cabs and accomodation. I was forced by a reputed leader to make people in Europe travel from Amsterdam to Germany by train instead of flying.Another employee was told by his manager to travel from Noida to Pune on a bus. There are numerous examples. This is a dead company. Don't invest your child's future in this company.IJP's are declined as leaership team don't have replacements. HR does not play a roleSales are being driven by individuals who believe that negative 16% in the first year of a deal is acceptable.If you do a certification on your own - IT will not be paid.
adviceToManagement: None of the frameworks are selling. High attrition in the sales team depicts the future.Please only sign up what you can deliver.Stop forcing people to travel on Buses between long distance cities.IJP system should be automated for approval.If IJP requests go to a manager who is short of resources he will never approve - rather automated approval if an employee has clocked relevant time in the system should be followed
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: Working at Tech Mahindra Pros and Cons
pros: If you are one of the top performers, you will get onsite and normal Growth.Most of the Projects are testing and support. Dev projects with newer technology stack are fewer. Canteen Gym and other employees facilities are good. You get TechMahindra Brand Name. Things are fine if you are top performer, otherwise any day anything can happen.
cons: For Ordinary performers, Very little Hikes, No Job Security these days they are firing people with 12, 17 years of experience and other performing employees as well. Mostly managers are non-technical. You are there in the company till you keep delivering, very little support if you get stuck with some technical issue, you are almost entirely on your own. Deliver and survive or perish anytime. Work Life balance and other things depends on the project. As in most organizations girls have relaxed rules.No hikes since past 2.5 years. Many employees were promised onsite but not given. Join only if you have no other relevant or better offer.
adviceToManagement: Do not Just focus on Cost cutting, By cutting out on basic employee amenities and delaying appraisals and not giving hikes. Please focus on bringing better longer projects, with newer technology stack. Please stop firing employees who have spent more than 5 years in the organization. I believe they have proved themselves.

pros: It was ok when I joined. But due to poor senior management policies and poor resource handling the company seems to be not doing all that well now.Good work life balance if working from client office. If it is in TechM office then it depends on the project.
cons: Although we see profits coming in during the quarterly reports the employees are not given any hikes. For the past two years hike is very bad and this year employees with experience above six years the hikes have been deferred. No growth for the employee. Promotions are also not given out promptly.
adviceToManagement: Transparency to be improved. Make sure that appraisals are given importance and the promotion and hike letters are handed out promptly. If you want to retain good resources who are in good client projects you have to give them proper hikes and promotions.

He kept on negotiating and reducing decided salary.I told I agreed to drop resignation only on this condition that I get salary which was discussed on interview and HR has no issues and confirmed the salary. But tech mahindra hr said if you agree with the this salary then only will send offer letter.
cons: Bad tech mahindra recruiting team is big time fraud
adviceToManagement: Don't make false promise and be loyal to candidates

pros: Pros –Somewhat flexible timings.Person will get to learn a lot of things technically, as well as process wise. The tenure will make resilient at least .Good canteen at noida nsez campus.
cons: Cons – In current scenario of slowdown, I would NOT suggest anyone to join this company unless one is in desperate need of job.Unnecessary policies are put into action by HRs.you would never know which ones are coming the next day.Job Insecurity: TechM is mostly dependent on BT, ATT projects. This projects are generally of very short duration (around 1.5 yrs-2yrs). Once project is completed, employee is released and put on bench. Now real problem arise here. The RMG(Resource Management Group) people do not help employee in allocation of another project. Employee have to search project on his own(if he has contacts), other wise after 1-2 months also he is project-less. Now another horrifying policy of company comes into picture. Employees are randomly called by HR on any fine day and are asked to resign (else he will be terminated). Overall job security is one biggest factor which is NOT in TechM’s dictionary. Even if the person is billable, he is working under fear of getting released/terminated.Appraisals: If person (generally with work experience of more than 4 yrs) is getting C rating, he is asked to resign by HR.
adviceToManagement: Got to improvise and raise the thinking level a lot.
position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than 3 years)

summary: Worst organization to start career, similar to jail.
pros: There is hardly any advantage but must say that Tech Mahindra have very large strength of highly experienced professional.
cons: In Tech Mahindra most of employees have high experience of about 12-20 years with age band of 40-50 years so these people do not care about career of new generation, freshers and college hires. There is lot of politics observed in this organization and very less chance of career progression. Experienced people do not give chance to learn as they were insecure of god knows what ?One more thing to add is managers do not want their employees to learn new things hence they do not allow for internal training so there is also very less chance to gain knowledge within organization.Not only managers but some employees were also there who are still working since 8 years with a salary of 14 thousand and do not have any option to leave as they were bound because they were not trained and limited to do same work for over years or decades.If someone ask me about what i have learnt in TechM i would say "Nothing other than internal politics".
adviceToManagement: Management should keep things consistent and have their process and policies standardized and equal to all irrespective of job level, also to keep salaries consistent without any ups and down such as miscellaneous deduction of over 60% and high salary over 150%.

pros: Nothing much here. I can only think of cons. Not a great experience working for this company.
cons: Not good management. It depends on ODC. Incompetent managers who don't have much technical knowledge. No work life balance. Managers expect you to implement a feature or provide fixes in less than a day's time. No design principles followed. Weekend work culture expected. No basic facilities like internet, can't even refer good blogs. Managers do not have clear picture of what is the plan for a week, keeps changing every day. No value for employee, if you stand against these managers or question them they will go to the extent of threatening employee that his job is vulnerable. Blame game culture. Lot of bench pool which is underutilised.
adviceToManagement: Please empower technical staff so that they can make final technical decisions. Managers should only have functional role. like approving leaves, time sheets etc.

summary: If I was offered double my wage I’d still have left
pros: I can’t say there were many tho most of the agents are very friendly and always up for a laugh.
cons: A complete lack of support from senior management. Get a tough customer and you’ll argue with them for an hour until a TL finally takes the call (providing it’s not half 4 - where 90% of them head home) and then the TL will go against everything you’ve argued with the customer about and give them something free to get them off the phone. Rota was a joke, at one stage, I was the only person taking calls for Tesco mobile at 7 in the evening as the other 5 people were scheduled for their break and calls started multiplying by the second.
adviceToManagement: Actually show some sort of reason why staff should even consider caring about their job.

summary: It is Ok, Nothing new to learn
pros: Only good thing about company is campus
cons: 1. Time Management- After joining the company i learnt the value of time. In the company we need to maintain 9 hours a day, so as soon i swipe in , monitor the time and monitor till it completes 9 hours. In other words i can say how successfully wasted my 9 hours a day for 6 months. A person login for nine hours doesnt mean he is productive for all the nine hours, so could see employees all around campus including cafeteria, as they have kill 9 hours as most of the projects doesnt have work and people on bench also should follow the same. As i had worked in product based companies, i felt very irritating to stay for 9 hours without work.2. Work from home- Though Band U4 and above have work from home facility, need to beg like anything to manager to get it. I could see many women employee who are carrying coming to office as they wont get WFH.3. ITC1, 2 and 3 are old building and their rest room is worst than government offices. Could see mosquitoes in the floor and need to carry mosquito bat as they wont provide extra power plug for mosquito repellent :) :)4. LAN is very restricted and nothing is accessible including gmail from LAN. For cost cutting they might have taken cheap LAN facility and there is no wifi in the campus :(5. Using the concept of Paper saving, There will not be any paper for Printers, you need to carry paper if you need to take Printout :D. You wont get tissue in cafe, washroom :(6. There will be no water dispenser for hot and cold water, so you wont get Hot water to drink. There will be coffee vending machine available across all floor to get hot water :( . For drinking water there are water filter, Since in Electronic city hardness of water is more where TDS more which almost 500+, they are using old water filter machine not sure whether those machine capable of removing TDS from water. Better to bring your own water to drink.

summary: Worst for freshers,career oriented employees, good for managers and higher level people who are coming from outside.
pros: You learn pure politics.You get some extra money in terms of shift allowance/on-calls.Less work pressure (project dependent)Less or no need to learn anything new. Just keep working as you were before 5 years policy.
cons: Too many...No hike.No salary revision for years sometimes.No employee growth and career opportunity.Worst TL/PM/senior management.Worst behavior of managers and they behave with you as they are CEO of company and your hike is the biggest topic to screw you.No work life balance, if they need you on sat-sun, you have to come.HR's are just close to useless and they never ever reply for mails.No new implementation project, no technology exposure.Your manager won't bother whether you are a genius, they just need to get the job done and have nothing to do with your talent.
adviceToManagement: Give hike, run some employee appreciation/ retaining programs.Sincere advise to HR that before you go marching on hiring with a big names outside, just have a look on bench where same technology people are rotting and willing to work in cheaper payroll.Managers must understand that people working under him are not puppets and they do have some knowledge over which they work,.Rotation of onsite position and make it mandatory.Bring some damn projects please, we are sick of support and wish to work in some new projects.We just keep working and do not even have idea what will be appraisal, please make sure a transparent system where work is appreciated, not your religion, locality or state.There are too many cons.Bottom line is I do not refer you for Techm if you are fresher. As a senior management employee you are welcome to screw us.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time

summary: Not a good place to work
pros: I have a bad back and can not stand for hours at a time, so I need to work at a job that I can sit down and move around a little.
cons: customer service is emotionally draining work. for 10.00 an hour i put up with a lot of name calling and getting yelled at by customers for fingerhut. We get 2 15 minute breaks and 1/2 hour for lunch but no benifits at all. No PTO, sick time,insurance, paid holidays or vacations. I have been here 8 months now and we never got the raise we were supposed to get, and I haven't earned 1 day of vacation yet. They gave us Christmas eve, Christmas Day, New years eve and New years day off, Plus a couple of storm days in January and with no holiday pay or PTO it really hurt the paycheck. There is not a decent break room for employees and only 1 microwave for everyone.
adviceToManagement: If you really want to grow in Fargo you will have to offer some benefits, people are not going to work and put up with the mistreatment that we get for 10.00 an hour with no benefits when they can get full benefits and better wages somewhere else. Of the 40 people that got hired with me only about 7 are left, and everytime you try to hire more they leave within weeks

pros: 1) Lot of client exposure.2) Good recognition (but doesn't necessarily means rewards!).3) Good onsite opportunities.
cons: 1) Very hectic schedule. I don't remember how many times I have worked beyond 12 in the night (in both of my projects during my stay here). Lot of weekend working.2) Even though I was NEVER rated below A / A+ (which means exceptional!) during 5 years of my stay, my salary was 6 lacs per annum at the end of 5 years. Others had even less!3) No opportunity to change your project if you don't like it.4) No much room or encouragement for innovative ideas.5) Most of the employees hired are average or below average, few are above average and very rarely you will find someone exceptional. With this situation, if you are a team leader, you are doomed!6) Too much cost cutting since 2009. No Diwali, New year or birthday gifts. Hikes were in single digits in the current year 2012. No paper towels in restrooms. Free filter coffee service has been stopped and its now priced at Rs. 5 for a MICRO cup.7) Strict attendance policy. A minute less than 8 hours logs a half-day absenteeism (however it can be approved by your supervisor, so need to be in good terms with your supervisor!).8) Heights of politics!!9) The single digit hike given in 2012 increased the variable pay. There was no change in the basic pay or special allowance!

summary: Your luck depends upon the project you get#not recommended for a fresher.
pros: I have worked with this org for 4.8 years since 2012 as a fresher. I have moved to another org. I have been to Hyd, Bangalore location of TechM. My training was done in SAP luckily and we were assigned to various projects.Some positives which I feel is worth noting:TechM does have good training infrastructure.Hyd Bahadurpally campus is nice and you may get dorms to stay inside the techM campus. There are separate hostels for boys and girls.The areas nearby provides cheap stays so If you get project in Hyd you can save a lot of money compared to Bangalore.Food inside the campus is cheap and if you stay in dorms, you have a happy life.Bus facility was good.Shift allowance if you have US /UK client. 225 for a day, 400 for a night. If you TL/Manager is cool, you can have easy life like leaving early and work from home.WFH is allowed for night shifts and some cases for women's.
cons: Man, cons are too many. I am writing the big ones which does matter and people do leave techM for these reasons.Not at all employee friendly policies and useless HR dept.You never get hike on time. This year Aug 2016 hike is delayed and my friends in techM are still waiting for hike. Also please note, they never pay any arrear for delay.No good projects in SAP. You have some old big support projects running which is a bad place for a fresher to start. You will learn nothing and would know only after years.SAP technology is sinking in techM and management has done nothing. There is one very huge SAP support project running in Bangalore location where fresher's are being utilized for all works as you just have to do brainless job daily.There are no implementation projects with techm, in any technology.Managers here are mostly very rude and non cooperative. They don't understand your personal issue and always treat you as slave.if you are stuck with some projects, forget getting release and you have to leave techM as last option.Lot of politics and language, state based groups which makes decision on stuffs without seeing merits and hard work.Management is pretty lazy and they never do any ground work, just give you false promises.Hike is very less and you get hike based on your relationship and sources inside management. You will be promoted only if you have good repo with managers.
adviceToManagement: Dear TechM management, please run a check on management issues and fire some lazy managers. You won't believe, people are surviving doing excel copy paste job for whole day. are you really hiring them for that work? Wake up before it's too late and people of TechM stop believing anymore in management and leave.

summary: A misfit for someone who has the fire in him/her
pros: If you don't have any aspirations to do a challenging job, you'll love this company. If all you want if work/life balance only, you'll get more of it.
cons: 1. HR policies sound dictatorial.2. No transparency in policy implementations - though there will be a nicely framed policy, its implementation - God only knows how it works.3. Senior Management don't seem to believe transparency is important for their team to be motivated enough. I'm not talking about 100% transparency here, because it's impossible to implement so to every 100000 employees. All I'm talking about is transparency to Senior Management representatives themselves.4. Organization doesn't seem to care about employee aspirations - I see people are mostly under-utilised, perhaps at a level lower than he/she was recruited. How on earth will someone be motivated enough??5. This is the only Organization where it's a near to impossibility for a skip-level meeting with your Super boss!! It's sometimes required guys!!! Grow up and understand...6. TechMighties are actually TechWeakies, not just in technology but in governance too.
adviceToManagement: Can you do something about what I'm depicted in pros and cons??

summary: Nice place to hangin for a while.
pros: Overall if yu don't want onsite desparately good place to hand around for some time and make decent good money.
cons: 1. Almost zero onsite opportunities. If you are really lucky or very high performer you may get a 2 to 3 months trip.2. Recently they stopped the bonus component of the salary which was additional benefit over the CTC. The bonus was a great added advantage and motivation of working in a captive. Although the Bonus is not stopped for manager and above levels. This does not really sound very fair.3. Struggling and fighting with vendors for projects as vendors also work on similar projects. Felt more like working in a vendor not a client place.4. Job not as secure like vendor companies5. Too many managers to manage very small number of people and lot of micro management in place pisses you off at times.6. Promotions are real slow and your career is the mercy of your manager. It is like kingdom and the manager is king with all powers.
adviceToManagement: Can't suggest anything to deaf management. They are always ready to spoil anyone's life for personal gains.

summary: NOT the company to begin your career with!
pros: Good Infrastructure in the Pune premises.
cons: Poor Resource allocation AFTER Initial Training Program.Poor resource allocation in the projects.Lack to technical managers.Poor man-managers.Very low salary for the amount of work done . Lack of quality appraisal program.Lack of onsite opportunities.Lack of promotions to deserving candidates. (You need to be a "YES-SIR " with your manager to get a promotion here!)Lack of understanding of the right resources to be sent Onsite!Favoritism amongst the managers towards certain resources.Exploitation of the resources as machines ,not humans!Improper management of Cab and allied services.
adviceToManagement: Need to allocate resources in a more efficient way in order to extract the best from the employee towards the Organization growth. A person with core interest and skilled in development is a waste in testing/support projects. You are putting a FULLSTOP on his/her career.There is a need to groom better Managers (Technical as well as Non Technical).There is a need to identify the RIGHT resources to be sent Onsite rather than ones sent for picnic purposes!Promote deserving candidates rather than "YES-SIR" candidates.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

pros: No pros to list out
cons: 1) Mediocre thinking of lateral entries2) Freshers blindly follow lateral entries and turn out to be zombies by the end of the day.3) Leave your brains at home and come to work @Tech Mahindra. Using brains is strictly prohibited over here.4) Tech Mahindra Pune branch has 'Kokanastha Brahmin' lobby. Anyone aprt from the above-mentioned caste is ostracized and becomes a topic of gossip.5) BMS portal has all psychos operating it. Even a 4th std. convent school student will write better BMS documents.6) No human consideration for pregnant employees. They have to run from pillar to post to get their maternity leaves sanctioned.7) Appraisals and awards such as "Bravo", "Pat on the Back" are directly proportional to employees licking their bosses' boots.8) The respective heads of verticals have no answer to the question, "Where is TechM heading?"9) Anyone joining TechM from a comparatively small company is given raw treatment by his/her boss and super-boss. Anyone joing from Infy, Wipro, Cognizant, etc. will be given a red-carpet welcome.10) New joinee's don't get workstations for almost 6 months. They have to hunt for absentee's (so that they could occupy their workstation for a day) or operate from the library; where the system's operating speed would beat even the snail's walking speed.
adviceToManagement: Senior citizens of TechM; welcome innovations with open arms instead of uplifting the ones who butter you. You white elephants have been drawing fat salaries since ages without being profitable to TechM. Chuck off the mentality atleast now when clients don't respect you even a bit.

summary: Worst experience ever as a Senior Software Engineer
pros: Good Campus with well equipped gym and fun games. Good facilities like swimming pool, table tennis, tennis basketball etc.
cons: When it comes to working for techmahindra, it was worst experience anyone could have. Joined this organization after 3.2years of experience in hand with purely development background. Struggled to get a development project. Somehow was assigned a work for 10days that too designing using css only. Worked as a nonbillable resource. After 10-15days again awarded with bench. Struggled 20-25days again to get a project of nearly 1month now with the same css design. Worked well with good quality and feedbacks from manager and TL. Then again came to bench after that. This time it was a long term struggle to get a project. Resource Manager even dint help me this time. After a month of bench got a call from HR to put down my papers forcefully as per corporate decision and cost cutting jus giving me 4-5days time. Then continued my struggle to keep my job in hand. But this was of no use. Had to put down my paper and left the company as a jobless. Was jobless for 15-20days to bag an offer from one of the fortune 100 companies and top 100 best companies to work for. This is how I proved them. They simply hire top notch employees from top MNCs and simply fire if u are of no use to them. U will simply b trapped. If you are a good resource and have real coding skills never ever join this company. You ll be trapped. So please stay away from this company. Few other cons are listed below.-No or very less hikes.-Upper management is lagging and unstable.-No work life balance-Not at all employee friendly.-Bad ratings if you are targeted to fire.
adviceToManagement: 1) Try to understand employees and evaluate who is good and who is non performer. Without evaluating don't decide to fire them. They have a family who are dependent.2) Try to be employee friendly so that company will be stable.3) Think before you fire.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (Less than a year)

adviceToManagement: Better TrainingGood packageBasic amenities should be available

pros: Bangalore - Two words "No Pros"
cons: 1. No transport for women after 6.45 pm There is only one TT per route. If you miss that you are on your own. If you are a woman or a mom rushing to get home, you are screwed.2. Most projects do not give work from home option.3. There is no hand tissue from few months - "Their save environment policy - more like save money policy"4. Groupism- Telugu folks just dont make you feel included5. Since there are no batch wise cabs, god should help you with safety if you are working late6. Mostly Rude and arrogant IBU heads and managers who are so full of themselves7. Peers are always trying to please dysfunctional managers8. Almost forgot the compulsory login hours per day is 9.5 hours where you are spared 0.5 hour to take a break, rest of the time you have to slog like a donkey in front of your desktop.9. No matter how much work you have you need to finish it by 6.30 pm if you want to catch the one miracle cab that will take you home away from this god forsaken place.
adviceToManagement: I have mentioned the cons. You know what needs to be done. Showing an inspirational video during induction will not magically change everyone's lives.

position: I worked at Tech Mahindra (Less than a year)

summary: Poor salary and promotion policies. Outdated Technologies and long working hours.
pros: Hardly anything positive for this company. I don't think there is much to talk about this company.Seriously I did not find much to talk after I compare myself with my previous companies.
cons: Poor salary hike even if you are 5 star rater. They also cheat on CTC. Take home is very less. Work without money. They have 9.5 hrs of work policy, which is like extracting every bit of energy out of you and squeeze you until you become old horse ready to be shot at any point of time.If you are very techie this company is not for you. Work here is of secondary outsourced type which probably does not need good technical knowledge. You may loose your technical touch if you stuck with this company for long. Avg. Salary hike is 3% per year. Appraisals are conducted per 1.5 years.Be aware .. You are not allowed to change project for 2.5 years even if you don't like it. So it's total risk if you don't get good project. Carrier will be on toss.No gifts, no perks, no parties or no other extra benefits. Please read offer letter carefully before joining.I recommend joining tech m should be your last option. We have most of the projects in support with outdated Technologies. Probably other good companies refused to work on such project.Pune hinjewadi location is so so far that generally takes 3 hrs daily to- fro commute. Add that to 9.5 hrs of mandatory work hrs. So generally 12-13 hrs of work day.
adviceToManagement: Please increase average salary hike. Do not hire talented guys as your company does not have good technical projects. Make promotion policies consistent. Daily work hours should be 8-8.5 hrs.

cons: 1. Less onsite opportunities with politics(I guess that is a common thing at most of the companies).2. Might feel that you are not getting apt for yourself if you are exceptional at your job.
adviceToManagement: Give the opportunities not excuses if you understand and accept there is someone who works exceptionally well and deserves. pros: Hmm let me think.......When I got offer From this Company I was soo Happy that I am going to join a CMML - 5 MNC But after my Joining It came into my worst nightmare of Life.Well One Good thing in this company is Onsite Opportunity.
cons: 1. No work culture. Managers are like Hitler they will constantly look onto your system whenever they roam to your work desk. If any employee will would take tea brake with another team mates at pentry then If manager watched that he will surly ask "Bhaiya Kaam Nahi Hai Kya" or If after long working hours if some one doing some gossping with another team mates again manager will ask "Bhaiya Kaam Nahi Kya" which is the worst thing I faced in this company.2. One more bad policy is you have to complete 9:30 Hrs in the campus including 9 hrs on System for this tracking there is Software in every System which will calculate each day of your timing on system. If you spend less than a min from 9 hrs they will surly deduct your salary of half day.3. If you took lunch for 1 hr again manager will ask you complete your lunch in 20 Mins only , Hah I can't Imagine manager will go this level of cheapness.4. No Outing for Team.5. No self morale & motivation6. Appraisal are the worst they will give you only 1 to 3% only.7. Salary is also very much less as compared to market standard.8. Timing is not flexible If you reach 1/2 hr late then again manager will warn you in arrogant way "This is my last warning to you".9. Onsite Opportunity, Only If you know how to butter your manager then this place is heaven for you. So for butternuts, this is the best place.10. My suggestion to all new joiners is "Think again. Its better to remain at home and search for another company then joining this one.
adviceToManagement: Try to Replace Managers because manager who are long enough with your company they assumed company is now our private property so they do whatever their wishes with their subordinates.

pros: Infrastructure:I work in the Hyderabad offices. The company seems to have spent lavishly on infrastructure and facilities for sports activities.
cons: 1. Unprofessional organization:Tech Mahindra is my 2nd organization. I have worked in Cognizant earlier for 5 years. When I compare the two organizations in the parameters of professionalism, I find Tech Mahindra lacking far behind. Most employees carry a 'sir' attitude towards their managers.2. Unfair Appraisals:From my experience, the appraisal here is only a formality. The organization may have an appraisal process in place but competencies within the organization do not follow the set process. I have not seen anyone insisting on the process of goal setting an evaluation of goals . It is solely based on the relationship between a manager and their subordinates (the yes sir attitude plays a major role here).3. Employees are not valued.This has clearly resulted in high attrition rate in the organization.4. Low Onsite salary:The Onsite salaries offered are among the lowest in the industry. I am originally from Mahindra Satyam. The Onsite salaries offered by Mahindra Satyam were much higher (>35%) when compared to Tech Mahindra.
adviceToManagement: 1. Value your employees and keep them motivated.2. Mangers should be tolerant to hearing a 'no' and should be open to alternate ideas.

pros: Working with Tech Mahindra was a great experience with me. The good point is that the company takes care for both ESAT(Employee satisfaction factor) and CSAT(Customer Satisfaction) and keeps a balance between both. The compensation policy of this company is also adored by many of the techmighty.The ITP gives a good head start for the freshers other than any other companies.
cons: Tech M should focus more on growing itself in locations like Kolkata where there is a good scope for business as well. After acquiring Satyam they should be moved to a many vertical organization which they are still to achieve.Another point that I observed that the HR is unable to put right talent at the right place.Through the ITP training grooming can be done to put a resource to a appropriate position which does not happen here.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

summary: TechM, no value of your choices
pros: Its a good place to work, with a lot of onsite opportunities. Some of the managers are really helpful and you get to work for AT&T and BT, giving you a chance to shift company as there projects are dispersed across industry.
cons: No value for you as a person. You are just a labor for them and they can put you in any department, irrespective of your skills talents and choices. They do not consider in which direction you want to grow, you will be allocated an arbitrary assignment without discussing with you and you will not be given a chance to opt out of it, even if there are better suiting assignment. Makes employees frustrated. Pathetic HR policies.
adviceToManagement: Take into consideration about the choices of freshers and there skill set. Your HR is totally useless and uses arbitrary methods for allocating assignments. Take into consideration the skills and talents of your employees for assigning departments to them. And be a bit more flexible in inter department movement.

adviceToManagement: If you don't value the resources you will be the loosers

summary: IT company less...more a political party
pros: I didn't find anything good still trying to write this "pros" section :)-If you make your PM happy then you may get onsite for sure(but don't ask for appraisal thereafter ;) )-They track you in all the ways for number of hours you work, attendance, shifts etc but more they do micromanagement, people (employees) find ways to make the tracking system fool.-COO & CPO are the only productive people ;) as for every minor things you need their approvals.-Once you complete 4-5 years with the company you are free to switch the projects very frequently and get all the benefits of onsite travel, trainings, VISA, certification etc. (This actually make the work environment worst and top performers and new employees always miss the benefits as someone close the PM already takes the benefits)-If there is requirement then they can hire you at good salary (after that dnt ask appraisal till you leave the company ;))-Corporate office HR floor are well maintained. (Rest placed are typical desi style maintained. Common glass like a railway station for drinking water)
cons: There are many.-Worst work culture-Worst Management-Worst salary model-Worst Appraisal system-Nothing is perfect ;)-Don't have good projects to work.-Too much micro management and bossing culture-Even if do outstanding work, management think its a part of your job nothing special. No motivation.-Not employee friendly at all
adviceToManagement: If you say multinational then you should stand equally with US & UK based multinationals in terms of work culture, policies etc.

position: I have been working at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)

summary: The last option for any professional. Join if you do not have any other job offer.
cons: After the merger with Mahindra Satyam, it is only getting worse. The policies are not employee friendly at all, by any means. In fact, they are as bad as it can get.- 9 day Privilege leaves (PL) were reduced. There is no concept of sick leave. It has to be adjusted against PL. If you are sick and have not filled your time sheets on time or applied for leave then you will lose pay for those days. They will not be adjusted against your existing PL balances.- Mandatory working hours were increased by 1.5 hour every day to 9.5 hours. When I left TechM, there was a rumour of making Saturdays working as well.-Hikes will be delayed by 4 to 6 months, always. Last year the employees were given either a no hike or a hike in between 2% - 6 %.The senior leadership will make it a point to brag about their generosity on this ridiculous hike.-Micro management at every level.The employees are monitored at every level right from the time one enters office till the time he/she leaves. It starts with a thumb impression/swipe card at the entry point first, then system first log in & last log out time. Lesser of the two is considered. This needs to tally with the time sheet entry or you will be eligible for a loss of pay, in case of any discrepancy which doesn't have your manager's approval.- Internet access is restricted and individual system key strokes are monitored & logged & maintained to determine productivity .-Employee performance feedback will be given and there is a use less mechanism in place to raise your grievance which will be chaired by a panel of deaf people.- Projects needs to be sourced by personal contacts as the resource management group is hopeless. People once allocated in a project will have to quit the company to change the project. If you are on bench then chances of your survival in the company will be very less.- My offer letter had fixed pay but the policy was changed later and a variable was introduced at the same annual pay. My monthly take home decreased due to this.- Employee retention bonus paid out after 5 years of service was slashed from 40k to 5k.- Freshers are expected to sign a bond of 2 years of continuous service or 2 Lacs rupees payout in case of breach of agreement.-Promotions are given to satisfy the employee but no raise is given. After the merger they are bringing the TG4 grade employees to TG3 grade employees.- Need less to say the above mentioned points will affect the working styles,attitude of the long timers in Tech Mahindra. Work environment is not exactly professional.
position: I worked at Tech Mahindra full-time (More than a year)
