summary: Not a bad place to work
pros: They have good unity and work well as a team. The training department is very friendly and helpful. Their infrastructure is top notch.
cons: This is purely from my experience. There are not many development projects and as a fresher, they dont give you an option or consider your skills while allocating you to a project. The bottom level HRs are quite friendly and good. But their managers or higher HRs behave very unethically and they literally threaten freshers. Freshers are especially bullied by these people whenever there they are forced to move or relocate to another location for the project, even though the fresher is not able to do so due to various reasons. They have a lot of other candidates who are willing to relocate for a particular project, but these guys will not give you any option of switching with them. I was literally told to accept or else i'll be fired. I had completed their ELITE training with a very good score and thought that I would make a good career in Tech Mahindra, but I had to quit because of this reason.
adviceToManagement: Tech Mahindra has lost a very good and dedicated employee, and who knows how many others have quit for the same reason. And kindly ask your HR managers not to behave as though they own the company.

pros: Good Medical Benefits,immediate management will work with you for flexibility. They will allow for unpaid time off if vacation is overly restrictive
cons: Holiday and Vacation did not transfer when I was offshored from ATT. Over half vacation time accrued lost even though our time in service on account was to be secure. The contract between TechM and ATT was not understood well for our level and seemed to be a moving target. We were treated as hourly in some ways and salaried in others. This was very confusing. Our pay and our career advancement seemed frozen ( 3 years) - I left after that so am not sure of any changes
adviceToManagement: Talent and salaried technical expertise cannot "fit/be treated" like hourly assembly line workers.

cons: You're on your own. The offshore employees deeply resent the US employees because the US employees are the facade used to make this company appear to be less of a third world exploitative sweatshop. The TM staff ignores the contractors until there is a hint of a problem from the client's perspective. Expect no loyalty - the client's word is the only word. Contractors are nothing but easily replaced revenue generators.
adviceToManagement: I was a contractor at Covisint brought in to replace a higher-paid (and far more qualified) employee who cost the company too much money. Your staff falsified my resume and lied to Covisint about my education and certifications. Nobody seemed to care until I used the phrase "business ethics".My advice to management? Don't lie to people.

pros: Lots of fun activities organized by the group Josh for the employees.
cons: Managers are adamant and lack the broader vision to balance between employee's own professional/personal goals and the organization's goals.Appraisals cycle is the biggest issues in TechM. They never get the process of appraisal done in time and that's very frustrating. Plus even while the company is making profits, the average appraisal is very depressing and low.The infrastructure is poor with cheap materials used. One good strong monsoon can bring the truth of the materials used in the buildings. This was my experience at their hinjewadi office in Pune.When it comes to onsite opportunities, skills and talent is given the last priority to select the deserving candidates. Other qualities like his/her personal rapport with the manager or visa ready resource( that also includes visa ready people from different projects) is considered the most.
adviceToManagement: Top management should pay attention to the grass root level problems. The main concerns is most of the managers are of old school and highly orthodox who are not open to the new ideas of doing things. Also some of the senior managers makes the professional work environment very personal and difficult for those who run them the wrong way. Appraisals should be addressed in the time effective and efficient manner. A lot of groups at the project manager and higher level where the employee is left alone and no one from senior management pays attention to him/her issues.

summary: Good working experience as Software engineer in CISCO
pros: I got into this company through campus interview. Technical interview and HR interview were fine for me. i got a nice package to work over there. after getting there 4 months of training and tough assessments were there. This is what gave me a smart career in TM. Sine I got the highest mark in all evaluation, I got selected for client cisco. Good working environment, nice salary, opportunity to learn more technologies, comfortable working time were good reason to stick to this company.
cons: If you get in there as a fresher, first 1 year is going to be a moulding period. Really a tough time. Most of the time have to do overtime work and late night work and sometime difficult to get salary increment. I faced this problem in my first year. But later i had a nice project in hand and good salary in my project.
adviceToManagement: I was really proud to work there, as this company includes everything like, social support, personal growth programs every weekends, monthly training and assessment.
